boardgame.name: Sensus
boardgame.description:
A set of five mind games which tests players' skills of deduction, guesswork, and intuition.

The objective of the first game, Mystery, is to correctly identify the mystery cards. Cards are shuffled and three or four are placed faced down in the center to become the Mystery cards. The rest are dealt between the players. Players then take turns to identify by guesswork, deduction, or telepathy the cards held by the other players. If correct, this card is placed facedown on its corresponding square in the board. The first player who correctly identifies the Mystery cards is the winner.

boardgame.name: Dust
boardgame.description:
Dust. A desert in the middle of a city; The City to be exact. The sounds of forges echo off the mountains, punctuated by the blast of a six-shooter. Slingers are judge, jury, and executioner. This place is so damned, even our monsters are cursed.

So read my words, and read 'em well, Slayer. Because all that monster hunting you did back in The City ain't gonna mean spit out here if you end up with a bullet in the back of your head.

Welcome to Dust.



What Is Dust

Dust is a supplemental zine for the tabletop RPG Slayers. You'll need Slayers in order to use Dust. It's a deep dive into one of the districts of The City, and a goldmine of information and resources for playing in Dust. What's in it? Great question, here's the highlight reel:


40 page, full color zine
Locations, NPCs, factions, and tables to roll on to fill the district with life
Illustrated hexmap, with optional travel rules for moving around in the Dust
Tons of original art illustrated by Mike Rieman
10 rumors to get your Slayers moving
4 adventures, each using a classic wild west trope (of course there is a train robbery)
8 new monsters that are going to crawl out of the Dust and kill you
A brand new class: The Deadeye


Inside you'll find the home of the Gunslingers. While many Slingers make their way to The City to take up slaying, some stay in the Dust. As the birth place of the Slingers, it's also where the fabled revolvers are made, forged by fanatics who worship the firearm like a god, with gunpowder and lead as their communion.

It's a district that toes the line between order and chaos. The Slingers keep the peace, but each of them has their own interpretation of that word. The monsters are cursed, making them crueler and harder to kill than many you'll find back in The City.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Greenopoly
boardgame.description:
Board game that uses the design and pattern of Monopoly, but uses businesses in Greene county, Pennsylvania.
There are chance cards, there are hotels and houses.

The board game is square, with moving pieces moving around the board on all its four sides, with the count of spaces moving forward dictated by a roll of the dice.

There is currency (money) and it is used for making real estate business transactions.

Winner of the game is whoever has most money after a predetermined time.

boardgame.name: Snowy God's Shrine
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The angry face of a stone god gleers down on those below, carved out from the side of a mountain. Waterfalls rush past him, spiraling around a circular platform beneath his broken, outstretched hands.

Paths leading to the platforms are crumbling and the platform itself is a ruin. Fallen rocks and ferns litter this ancient place, while trees dig their roots into the snowy surrounding mountainside.

Below the crumbling bridges curves a steep gully, with sharp rocks littering the shallow water far, far below. The wind creates an eerie scream here, as it passes through the hands of the god.

boardgame.name: Forked River Lake
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A large, tranquil lake ripples in the wind. It is fed by multiple streams and surrounded by steep, rocky shores. Green trees and ferns surround its edges, along with wildflowers. A fallen tree forms a bridge over one of the streams, while several stone paths criss-cross over the waterways in various states of ruin.

A small trail leads down to the water. Loud birdsong calls out from the surrounding greenery and hares dart amidst the bushes.

boardgame.name: Zebutap's Frozen Steps
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An altar of stone steps surrounded by pillars emerges from this frozen lake, fed by many streams. Its shores are steep stone cliffs, decorated with frozen trees and snowy ground.

A fallen tree forms a bridge, while sloping stone paths lead down to the lake at separate points. White wildflowers bloom despite the frigid air, and crumbling stone litters the ground.

There is slow movement beneath the ice, as if an ancient being dwells there, deep in slumber…

boardgame.name: Volcanic God's Shrine
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The scorched face of an angry stone god gleers down on those below, carved out from the side of a mountain. Waterfalls of lava crawl past him, spiraling around a circular platform beneath his blackened, outstretched hands.

The lava crackles and tinkles like breaking glass, the sound echoing loudly within the vast cavern of stone. Paths leading to the platforms are crumbling and soot-stained, while the platform itself is in ruins.

boardgame.name: Dreary Hollow's Bone Pit
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The stench of ammonia and rotting fish overpowers this muddy pit. Flies buzz loudly while small creatures writhe around in the muck, some of them consuming the hovering bugs with long, sticky tongues.

A large skeleton has been partially revealed by a constant, drizzling rain. It lays in the center of the pit, in mud so thick it would suck humans down to their thighs. Many unsuspecting locals have perished in their attempt to reach it, falling prey to bigger creatures that swim beneath the surface of the muck.

The trees and ferns around this area have all died; their leaves dry and brittle, crumbling at a touch. Only small, grey flowers survive. They catch flies in their sticky center, attracting them with a foul smell, before closing their petals around them and filling with a digestive fluid.

Few come to this terrible place, and even fewer leave.

boardgame.name: Harkuko's Lake Shrine
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Blossoming pink cherry blossoms fill the air with their sweet scent. They decorate the rocky hillside, covering the paths and ferns below with petals.

There is a lake filled with waterlilies and fish. Oriental bridges reach across it, leading to a small circular temple with a tiled roof.

Stones decorate the rough shoreline and the sound of running water ripples pleasantly across this secluded valley.

boardgame.name: God's Shrine
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The angry face of a stone god gleers down on those below, carved out from the side of a mountain. Waterfalls rush past him, spiraling around a circular platform beneath his broken, outstretched hands.

Paths leading to the platforms are crumbling and the platform itself is a ruin. Fallen rocks and ferns litter this ancient place, while trees dig their roots into the harsh surrounding mountainside.

Below the crumbling bridges curves a steep gully, with sharp rocks littering the shallow water far, far below. The wind creates an eerie scream here, as it passes through the hands of the god.

Adventure Idea

A friendly young man wearing colorful patchwork clothes with a wooden staff approaches you for help. He needs to complete a ritual at an ancient worship site and claims to be the descendant of a forgotten deity. He says he can hear the god whispering to him, in his mind. He pauses often in the conversation, making snarky comments to someone who isn’t there, joking, or laughing merrily.

He explains that the ritual will allow him to fully inherit his godly powers, however there are evil cultists who guard the site. Should you help him past and complete the ritual, he will grant you a wish. He also claims he can perform miracles, but when he waives his hand to show you nothing happens and he instead bursts out in laughter; wiping tears from his eyes.

Arriving at the site you see armed figures in plate armor standing at different points. Each wears a different metal mask, shaped into the calm faces of old men or women. As soon as they see the young man, however, they yell that the Forbidden One has arrived and begin to shoot arrows at him. The man squeals and ducks behind a rock, covering his head with his hands.

WHAT’S HAPPENING? The “cultists” are an order of academic knights, descended from those who nearly eradicated the old god from the world. They thought they had killed all the mortal descendants of his bloodline generations ago, until they received a prophecy about one who had survived and would attempt to reincarnate the god near this date.

They espouse reason, mathematics, and order. If the players try to communicate the cultists will claim their ancestors fought long and hard to eradicate the god. They say you don’t understand the chaos your actions will release should you help the young man. That, despite his kindness, he needs to die so the god can never return.

If you kill the young man, flowers the color of his patchwork clothes will grow up around his body and the statue of the god will crumble. Should you fend off the cultists and help him instead, he will prance around with his staff; beating the knights merrily while yelling nonsensical things at them.

Once the ritual is complete his personality will become even more exuberant and his speech will make even less sense. He will grant your party’s wishes, only each one will manifest in unexpected yet positive ways—after all, you have just reincarnated the god of madness. Once the wishes are complete, he will disappear in a puff of purple smoke and sparks.

boardgame.name: Timekeeper
boardgame.description:
The Timekeeper values precision. Their weapon of choice is the crossbow. Using their Timepiece, they can perform small manipulations of time. They can provide Slayers advantages and monsters disadvantages through small time disturbances.

This is an new class for Slayers

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Generica Floorplans Volume 03: Bistro
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Hinterland Mapview can help you minimize the amount of prep time for your next homebrew campaign!

GENERICA Floorplans are a combination of traditional 2D maps and 3D visual aids which can help you flesh out your campaign setting. Generic fantasy town locations (such as Taverns, Temples and Shops) are showcased with carefully designed floorplans and 3D rendered views to provide your players with a more immersive gaming experience.

Each GENERICA Floorplans volume contains one 3D Exterior Mapview, two isometric top-down Floorplan Maps, as well as additional 3D renders of Interior Mapviews. Each download also includes two full-sized gameplay maps designed to be printed at 16” x 20”.

boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Trading Card Game â€“ Revenge of the Sith
boardgame.description:
The fate of the galaxy is in your hands.

An epic struggle between good and evil continues, and now you must take a side - the light side or the dark side. The Star Wars trading card game lets you and a friend engage in full-scale battles. You can choose to embrace the power of the Sith Lords or to align yourself with the Jedi Knights and use the Force for a higher purpose.

Star Wars: Trading Card Game is not all that different from Magic:TG. Like many TCGs, Star Wars comes in two player starter packs, individual deck starters, and the obvious booster packs. Cards include characters, ships, devices, and all of the original, first edition decks deal with Star Wars Episode II: Attack Of The Clones.

To play your first real game you will need to collect (or print out) two decks of 60 cards, a set of six sided dices, a set of damage counters, two force meters and a playmat with 3 battle zones(space, ground and character areas).

boardgame.name: 100 Overheard Cyber City Chatter V 11.0
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The city overwhelms the senses. Neon against rainy black sky, reflecting in the puddles. Smells of things out of the sewers mix with the deep fried offerings of street vendors. Stale sweat so heavy in the air you can taste it. The most overwhelming of all is the sound… especially the endless sea of chatter. This list provides 100 random things that a group of heroes might hear in a cyberpunk city setting. Some things are worth taking note of, other things are just verbal garbage.

boardgame.name: Great Apes Survival Game
boardgame.description:
An educational and fun cooperative adventure to rescue the Great Apes from ruthless Poachers and move them Sanctuaries with the help of the Rangers.

The Great Apes Survival Game, featuring Dr. Jane Goodall, is a one-of-a-kind educational and exciting board game created for children ages 6 and up that 2-4 people can play in about 30 minutes. The premise of the game is to educate children about endangered species, in particular, the great apes; how they are endangered, in a beautifully designed game environment while having fun. Through cooperative game play, children learn animal facts and practice math, reading, geography and science.

boardgame.name: 100 Cyberpunk Apartment Stuff
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Studio Apartments: The new suburbs for folks lucky enough to not have to sleep their night off in capsule hotels. So you have come across a few corporate stiff types or maybe some fixers, mercs, and netrunners with a few extra bucks to spend on rent? The group planning on looting these folks? Maybe there’s a murder to be solved? Just curious as to how the “better to do” folk live in their cramped little apartments? If the group is gonna do so prying around on these folks’ private property you might to have a few personal possessions lying about to give the place some flavor… this chart is full of such things. This list provides 100 different things that you might find in a cyberpunk era apartment, all crammed on to one easy to use page. You’ll find everything from baggies of stuff to jewelry to food to clothing to weapons to assorted other stuff here– some things might be worthy clues if the GM is running a neon city “whodunnit” scenario.

boardgame.name: Tanks Î²
boardgame.description: Tanks β is a low-priced edition of Tanks+. Original Tanks+ was designed as an introduction to wargaming. In Tanks β, the rules are more compressed so that you can concentrate on basic shooting between tanks. Although there is a limit to the number of vehicles, Tanks β is a valuable game, so you can enjoy the real thrill of tank battles with only the core system.

boardgame.name: 100 Cyberpunk Apartment Stuff 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Studio Apartments: The new suburbs for folks lucky enough to not have to sleep their night off in capsule hotels. So you have come across a few corporate stiff types or maybe some fixers, mercs, and netrunners with a few extra bucks to spend on rent? The group planning on looting these folks? Maybe there’s a murder to be solved? Just curious as to how the “better to do” folk live in their cramped little apartments? If the group is gonna do so prying around on these folks’ private property you might to have a few personal possessions lying about to give the place some flavor… this chart is full of such things. This list provides 100 different things that you might find in a cyberpunk era apartment, all crammed on to one easy to use page. You’ll find everything from baggies of stuff to jewelry to food to clothing to weapons to assorted other stuff here– some things might be worthy clues if the GM is running a neon city “whodunnit” scenario.

boardgame.name: Net Encounters 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

From data cowboys to erratic AI entities to lonely losers looking for an easy score… the net is a lively place. This 30 sider roller features a bunch of colorful encounters that the GM can throw into the online side of their cyberpunk rpg game. Entry has a character name/online handle and some details.

boardgame.name: Flawed Merchandise
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A mini side adventure for your cyberpunk themed rpg game! This system generic product features a 1 page location that functions as a drop in side mission. The Game Master (GM) is welcome to modify or add details to this product as they see fit.

Background: A whole lot of nasty crap has been flooding the streets of the city lately. People have been getting permanent nerve damage from faulty unregulated neural processors and others are having hallucinations and other adverse reactions from a new supply of synthetic cocaine. Back alley cyber clinics are getting raided after agreeing to install the faulty cyberware and the “more respectable” fixers on the streets are afraid that they will be targeted by law enforcement heavies next. There’s a lot of talk these days and a good deal of that talk is about how the streets can get back to their normal tolerable levels of crime and chaos. The solution? Get rid of some flawed merchandise and take down the person responsible for it.

Enter Tony “Rotter” Callis.

Rotter is a well known local scumbag who has managed to grow his business through profitable street deals throughout the years. A few years back Rotter got into importing and selling of cheap merchandise. This legit approach is little more than a front that allows him to continue dealing in more lucrative (and very illegal) dealings. His latest contraband hustles have included pushing synthetic cocaine that he gets from an outside supplier (Dexter Midnight) and the selling of imported Amaka-Orion brand cyberware (notably neural boosters known to cause nerve damage). Rotter runs his legit and illegal business ventures out of two side by side businesses. The main one is East Path Imports (an importing company located in the larger map building) and the second is Trinkets & Gifts (street vendor shop located below the main building).

Adventure Lead In: There’s a whole lot of local people who want Rotter dead and his supplies of cyberware and synthetic cocaine destroyed. The characters are just as likely to be hired by a back alley clinic or a notorious drug dealer as they are the proper authorities. With the right connections a particularly savvy group might even be able to cash in more than one payoff to do the job! Just be careful though… Rotter has made enough profits to hire more than a few goons.

boardgame.name: Star Age Vid Feeds
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

As you stroll down the corridors of the space station your eyes and ears are assaulted by the brightly lit, blaring sounds coming from dozens of monitors and holovid projectors. It seems like everyone and everything in this star sector is busy broadcasting something. What do you see and hear though?

This thirty sider chart provides a variety of things that the traveling characters might see and overhear coming from various monitor screens, holo projectors, etc. Some stuff might be useful while other things are just annoying garbage.

boardgame.name: 50 Hirelings 6
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Adventurers need hirelings… from traveling companions to camp defenders to folks working the fields back home. This 50 list offers a collection of such individuals who are ready for hire. Included in each entry is the following: first and last name, gender, role/occupation, active description, background description, and expected daily wages in copper or silver coins.

boardgame.name: Reliquary
boardgame.description:
Reliquary is a tabletop roleplaying game about wanderers exploring a vast megastructure tens of millions of years in the future.

Uncover buried temples to forgotten gods, traverse endless staircases through the megastructure’s strata, and push your luck as you delve deeper in search of powerful relics to help your society survive.

Reliquary is a GM-less game of exploration and collaborative world-building. The last vestiges of humanity are spread out across the Coil—a megastructure built over the course of multiple lost civilizations. 2-4 players will build a Coil unique to your play session and then search the remains of what they build. Reliquary is designed to be played either as a one-shot or as a longer campaign as you explore multiple layers of the Coil.

This game is inspired by the brutalist environments of the game NaissanceE and the manga BLAME! as well as the weird architecture found in the art of H.R. Giger and Zdislaw Beksinski.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: 100 1980s Era Bystanders 6
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different innocent (and not so innocent) bystanders that are perfect for adding to your retro rpg campaign. Included in each entry is a first and last name, gender, age, and role/occupation.

boardgame.name: BRP SRD
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is Basic Roleplaying System Reference Document in Rich Text Format, manuscript-style, with minimal paragraph styles and useful character styles applied.

Suitable for editing, hacking, folding, spindling, and mutilating!

This is not a pretty-looking [document] - but it works!

boardgame.name: Dark Domains: Secret Cabal Cards
boardgame.description: A set of six cards originally available as part of The Secret Cabal's 2020 Kickstarter Campaign. Set includes henchmen: Jamie - Master of Power, Tony - Master of Wisdom, Don - Master of Intellect, Chris - Master of Savagery, Steve - Master of Evil and Brian - Master of Calculation.

boardgame.description:
A promo card originally available as part of The Secret Cabal's 2020 Kickstarter campaign.

Cupid is a God card. Text on the card says "When Constructing: If you build next to exactly two buildings, built by different players (can include you), both players gain a Senator. This is in addition to the regular effects of your Construct action. Reroll the die used to take this action and add it back to your available dice, allowing you to take an additional action this round.

boardgame.name: Cosmic Voyage
boardgame.description:
Cosmic Voyage is a 1-4 player cooperative game where players must work together to bring their stranded spacecraft home safely, navigating a dangerous galaxy of hazards and alien threats.

As a team, players explore the dangerous discovery zone - an ever changing and partially obscured grid of cards, carefully choosing where to explore to undertake the skill challenges on each.

Game events such as Solar Storms, Black Holes and Wormholes lurk as an ever-present threat to players both exploring and seeking refuge outside of the discovery zone. And those brave enough to venture into discovered wormholes can fight through a challenging series of tasks for even better rewards, for ever greater risks!

Players win or lose together, and must share responsibilites for keeping the ship running whilst utilising their specialisation to complete missions to help progress them toward their goal!

—user summary

boardgame.name: Jeu du trans europ express
boardgame.description:
The game is based on a famous rail road : the "Trans European Express". The main goal is to visit 6 capitals in Europe and to be the first to return to the city from where you started. You can travel by train either on the Trans European Express route or on other lines.
Taking turns to move, you are allowed to move as many stations as the number shown on the dice you throw.You have to stop and wait a turn when you come to a capital you wish to visite and also when you change from one railway line or ferry to another.
If you wish to change from one railway line or ferry to another, you have to pick up a CHANCE card and follow the instructions it gives you. Sometimes these instructions will help you on your way. Some other times thay will add time and trouble to your journey.
You can draw a card that allow you to close stations and neither you nor any other playermay go thourgh it except with a special card "remove one train signal" or a 6 on the dice.

boardgame.name: ToteMonstros
boardgame.description: ToteMonstros is a dice flicking game in which fantasy creatures battle in an arena. Each player has a few dice and moves them around the playing field. If several dice end up in the same spot, they can be stacked up. Players can attack other players' dice by flicking from higher stacks than the victim's. Hitting an opponent's dice does damage to their creature, flicking dice out of the arena (your own or others) removes these from play, but they can be reintroduced later. The goal is to eliminate the enemy team(s).

boardgame.name: The Garden of the Spire Queen
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The Garden of the Spire Queen is a self-contained region with encounters, rumours, locations, a new faction and a settlement description of Honigspitze, the home of the Spire Queen, for the Mausritter roleplaying game.

boardgame.name: Candy Shop
boardgame.description:
A game about running a candy shop.
The active player can reveal a square tile and turn it in any direction they want. On each side of the tile, there are candy icons, and each player takes the tokens corresponding to the side facing them. In later turns, players can use their candy tokens to purchase victory point cards (which also give additional advantages in subsequent turns, but players who choose this option may not reveal a tile on their turn.
The game ends when no player can purchase any more cards, or when the tile stack runs out. The player with most victory points is the winner.

boardgame.name: Reflets d'acide
boardgame.description:
Maender-Alkoor ...
All began in Maender-Alkoor ...
In this medieval fantasy universe created by the GHC, the God of Hazards and Chance, you are a narrator, a celestial entity, whose role is to follow and tell the epic destiny of designated heroes! But now, on this day, your tutelary god allows you to guide proud adventurers so that they succeed in a sacred quest ...

Cooperation (1, 2 or 3 players)
Two Vile Narrators have teamed up with a major evil deity: the Void. Their team of adventurers is about to complete a Tainted Quest ... Your god commands you to counter their misdeeds by entrusting you with the outcome of the opposite Quest. Your opponents progress as the Avatar of the Void pursues your proteges ... In order to stop the infernal spiral imposed by the Void, a beautiful campaign punctuated with challenges awaits you!

Competition (2 to 12 players)
On this day, your god is generous: he grants you the use of various divine gifts! You will be able to enlist five courageous Heroes, select their Quest and guide their Destiny… Alas, your adversaries will harm your designs, not to mention the Dragon, also on the way… So many vicissitudes, the fight will be hard!


Maender-Alkoor...
Tous commenca à Maender-Alkoor...
Dans cet univers médiéval fantastique créé par le DAH, le Dieu des Aléas et du Hasard, vous êtes un narrateur, une entité céleste, dont le rôle consiste à suivre et à conter la destinée épique de héros désignés ! Mais voilà qu'en ce jour, votre dieu tutélaire vous permet de guider de fiers aventuriers afin qu'ils réussisent une quête sacrée...Coopération (1, 2 ou 3 joueurs)
Deux Vils Narrateurs se sont acoquinés avec une divinité maléfique majeure : le Néant. Leur équipe d’aventuriers est sur le point d’accomplir une Quête viciée… Votre dieu vous enjoint de contrer leurs méfaits en vous confiant l’issue de la Quête opposée. Vos adversaires progressent tandis que l’Avatar du Néant poursuit vos protégés… Afin de faire cesser la spirale infernale qu’impose le Néant, une belle campagne ponctuée de challenges vous attend désormais !

Compétition (2 à 12 joueurs)
En ce jour, votre dieu se montre généreux : il vous octroie l’usage de divers dons divins ! Vous pourrez enrôler cinq Héros courageux, sélectionner leur Quête et guider leur Destin… Hélas, vos adversaires nuiront à vos desseins, sans compter la Dragonne, elle aussi en chemin… Tant de vicissitudes, la lutte sera rude !

boardgame.name: Keep the Heroes Out!
boardgame.description:
An asymmetric, cooperative dungeon defense game for 1-4 players where you play as the monsters protecting their hard earned treasures against invading hordes of looters (so-called heroes) trying to steal it.

In their turn players draw 5 cards and play, these cards allow them to move, activate the tiles they are to perform the tiles actions, attack heroes, and move their units around. After each player, draw and perform cards from the heroes deck.

Your goal as a team in every scenario is to survive the 3 levels of threat from the invading heroes by protecting the treasures on each room. If the main treasure is taken, the game ends end you loose, but if you manage to protect the treasures for long enough, you all win.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: YakatapÃ©
boardgame.description:
This old fashioned boardgame is based on the Whac-a-mole arcade.
It's full mechanic, no need of batteries.
The ghost comes out randomly and just must crash them as quick as you can.
You launch the timer and you crash as much ghost you can. Each time you crash one, a counter increase from one. At the end of the timer, you add the 5 counters. The player with the biggest number wins.
When you pronounce "Yakatapé", it means in French "You only need to bit".

boardgame.name: Crimson Spire: A Trophy Gold Incursion
boardgame.description:
Enter your dreams and ascend an alien and haunted tower. Reach the top and be granted great power. Falter, and you will not wake from this nightmare.

Theme: Dream

The Crimson Spire is a city that visits our collective dream, when a red moon hangs high in the sky and the stars hide in the inky void of space. The Spire is a wholly alien place, built by the dreams of worlds far and wide. Those who walk the halls long enough may earn the interest of the Crimson Queen. She is known to grant boons to those who can bring her something interesting from within her realm.

This is an incursion for the game Trophy Gold, by Jesse Ross, submitted as part of the 2020 Trophy Gold contest. Over 5 sets, the treasure-hunters will explore a city made of dreams, all in the hopes of winning the favor of the red-clad matriarch that sits at the top of the Spire. If they succeed, their dreams come true. If they don't...ruin.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: LIGHT: Core Rules
boardgame.description:
Shine Bright

You are a Beacon, an immortal guardian of the last city on Earth. Human civilization crumbles across the system, but you and your kind are a ray of hope in a dark time.

LIGHT is a rule-lite sci-fi RPG. In it, you play as the immortal Beacons, wielders of weapons and the elements themselves. As a squad, you will go on tactical Strikes, pushing back against the Dark that has begun its slow march across the system. Explore ancient ruins for help and resources, fight back against alien forces looking to destroy a weakened Earth, and unravel the mysteries that bind together Light and Dark.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: LIGHT: Lighthouse
boardgame.description: The last city on Earth. Rules on running the factions, completing bounties for them, and receiving boons for your hard work.

boardgame.name: LIGHT: Nemesis
boardgame.description: Discover some of the alien factions the Beacons must fight across the system. Rules for enemies during fights, and examples of units from the first four enemy factions of LIGHT.

boardgame.name: LIGHT: Vulcan
boardgame.description: The weapon catalog! Rules on getting and creating loot, lots of weapons and tags, and some examples of legendary weapons the Beacons will seek.

boardgame.name: LIGHT: Complete
boardgame.description:
Collected Edition that includes.

LIGHT: Core Rules
LIGHT: Lighthouse
LIGHT: Nemesis
LIGHT: Vulcan

boardgame.name: LIGHT: Kindle
boardgame.description:
From Development Log

The first module for the season has arrived! I thought what better way to get things started than by bringing on new class options for the Beacons. I know that as a Destiny player, I not only strongly connect
with my class (warlock for life), but the way each elemental subclass feels different makes things really fun.
Why is it called Kindle? Kindling is usually associated with fire, but all the elements are represented here. That’s because Spark is about all the different kinds of light that can grow. Roaring fires, cracking lightning, and even the brilliant nether-glow of the void. So Kindling is
how our Beacons get started, sparking them to life and getting them started with their adventures.

Kindle brings a more “complicated” version of character creation, where players not only choose what elements to be best at, but now they decide how to divide Health and Light. Doing so allows players to decide if they want to be able to take a beating but limit their Light access, or be glass cannons that burn bright but hopefully not too bright.

Each class has Powers fitting the element, but also a new melee and perk. I realize that some folks may have liked the generic melee and perks from the core rules, and invite GMs to allow their players to use those instead if they prefer.

The real question is, once a player chooses one, then what? I think we’re going to need some Strikes that inspire the Beacons to go seek out dangerous and powerful locations across the system, to become more attuned to their Light and gain access to the other subclasses.

boardgame.name: Forge: A Spark Module for LIGHT
boardgame.description:
From Development Log

The second module in Spark is Forge, and brings out my interpretation of armor in LIGHT.

A huge component of playing Destiny is grinding out for gear. Whether its weapons or armor, you are seeking out just the right loot to fit your play style.

Loot is something that I’ve wanted to introduce more clearly in LIGHT, beyond the little bit in the Lighthouse module. Forge is the first step in doing so, by bringing armor to the game. Rather than breaking up armor into a bunch of individual pieces with their own bonuses, you just have 1 piece of armor when you go on a Strike.

But that deviates from Destiny so much! That’s true, but LIGHT is supposed to be fast in play, and if you are tracking a bunch of small bonuses across your class, weapons, and individual armor pieces, well…it’s going to start feeling like 5E, and nobody wants that.

Armor can be upgraded, and it requires the Beacon to do something that is fitting of what the armor is supposed to do. This rewards players who lean into their class type and choose an armor piece that fits the way they like to play.

Casts are the other thing in Forge! Grenades weren’t in the core LIGHT rules, but I knew I wanted them eventually. Grenades are one time use actions that Beacons can take in a fight, that will help swing things in their favor.

boardgame.name: MÃ©thodologie: The Murder on the Links
boardgame.description:
Take on the roles of suspect and sleuth from Agatha Christie’s acclaimed detective novel The Murder on the Links. Use your “little grey cells” to gather evidence, eliminate suspects, and ultimately level an accusation.

The game of Méthodologie is played in two distinct phases:
the INVESTIGATION PHASE and the ACCUSATION PHASE.

In the INVESTIGATION PHASE, the players will reveal cards from their hands, then interrogate each other in order to eliminate leads. This sequence continues until each player has only one character, one location, and one object left in hand.

In the ACCUSATION PHASE, the players will place target tokens to make accusations about the remaining cards in each other’s hands. Any cards not correctly identified by majority accusation will be scored when the game ends.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: JUNGLA
boardgame.description:
On the summer solstice, the longest day of the year, on the wild, faraway island of JUNGLA, two fearless packs – the KNIGHTS commanded by the powerful LION CAYDEN and the PIRATES led by the cunning TIGER DHURTA – battle for the TAWA HALLAE, the scepter of power of the animal world.

THERE CAN ONLY be ONE KING! A terrible struggle is underway to reach the enemy hunting squares. Animals fight duels to the bitter end, in which each animal has unique fighting abilities.
Luck won’t decide the outcome of this contest. Let the battle cry ring out: Brave in the melee, loyal to the KING! Only the side with the most courage, strategy, cunning, and speed will emerge victorious.

SUMMARY OF RULES
There are 2 packs, each consisting of 15 animals. Each animal moves in different directions and a specific number of squares depending on its abilities. The direction and number of squares
permitted for each move depends on whether the animal starts from a land or a water square. Hit animals are imprisoned and removed from the board. The aim is to take the animals in your pack from the den squares to the enemy hunting squares, achieving a point. The first pack to score 5 points or to imprison all the enemy animals wins.

—description from designer

boardgame.name: Quantum Chess
boardgame.description:
Quantum Chess is a set which can be used to play four Chess variants. Two are played on a 10x10 board and two on a 12x12 board.

All use additional pieces, most notably the bowman, which cannot capture normally. Instead, it moves like a non-jumping knight, and after moving captures a piece on the square an additional knight's move away in the same direction. The other new pieces are combinations of existing pieces or the bowman plus existing pieces.

boardgame.name: Head AS Code
boardgame.description:
Simon Fournier woke up. He instantly realized something was amiss. That day was April 22, 2022 and he finally finished his exams! He was going home in a train with his childhood friend, Jasmine, and his roommate, Marco. However, when he woke up, he realized he was not in the train. He was somewhere else. But where?

In the company of friends, strangers and foes, he has no choice but to play this dangerous game introduced as the Dating Game. It's not a joke; it's dangerous. If they failed, they would die. It is a merciless environment where tensions rise from seemingly nothing, where no one is safe. Any misstep could get you killed.

One question quickly became two, then five, then twenty. What is Smiley's real identity? Who really are the other participants? Is Smiley really among them? What is the purpose of the Dating Game?

And most importantly... Who will be making the sacrifice?

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Im Auftrag des Orakels
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Schon viele Jahrtausende bevor der Blaue Mond zerbrach und seine Trümmer auf Lorakis niederregneten und damit das Schicksal der Völker maßgeblich beeinflussten, war das Manteion in Ioria der Sitz des göttlichen Orakels. Pilger aus allen Regionen des Kontinents kommen hier zusammen, um von den Göttern Antworten auf ihre drängendsten Fragen und kryptische Prophezeiungen zu erhalten. Weltlicher Wächter des Orakels ist der Orden der Bewahrer, der die Weissagungen der Götter aufnimmt, dokumentiert und in den legendären Kristallchroniken verwahrt.

Im Auftrag des Orakels enthält drei der bestplatzierten Abenteuer des gleichnamigen Splittermond-Abenteuerwettbewerbs von 2017, für den vorliegenden Band erweitert und vollständig überarbeitet.

Als einer der wichtigsten iorischen Götter nimmt der weise Eughos eine bedeutende Rolle rund um das Orakel ein, und so ist es nicht verwunderlich, dass gerade seine Gläubigen und Priester regelmäßige Gäste des Orakels sind. In Die Schale des Eughos werden die Abenteurer als Begleitung eines Eughos-Priesters angeheuert, um ein heiliges Artefakt aus den Tiefen des Horeth-Gebirges zu bergen und es vor den Häschern eines finsteren Kultes zu schützen.

Dass der Einfluss Eughos’ auch weit über Ioria hinausgeht, erfahren die Abenteurer in Auf den Spuren der Schildkröte. Über den Orakelpfad gelangen sie nach Siprangu, wo sie einem prophetischen Rätsel auf die Spur kommen und sich schließlich den Prüfungen des Gottes stellen müssen.

Doch natürlich benötigen auch andere Glaubensgemeinschaften Beistand und tapfere Begleiter. Schafblut führt die Abenteurer ins ferne Elyrea, wo eine verheerende Krankheit die Lebensgrundlage der mürrischen, aber friedfertigen Gnome im Landesinneren bedroht. Des Rätsels Lösung steckt in einer Prophezeiung, die auch die Abenteurer selbst einschließt.

boardgame.name: Das Prisma
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Shahandir, der Schmelztiegel zweier Kulturen, entstand, als Farukan in einem strategisch günstigen Moment das dalmarische Herzogtum Varnhal eroberte. Während in der öffentlichen Wahrnehmung dalmarische und farukanische Werte, Bräuche und Kulturgüter harmonisch nebeneinander bestehen, sehnt so mancher Dalmarier in den verfallenden Mauern seines Familiensitzes die alte Ordnung wieder herbei.

In Das Prisma wird eines dieser einstmals stolzen Anwesen zum Ziel der Abenteurer, als sie im Auftrag einer iorischen Wahrheitsfinderin die Rätsel einer uralten Prophezeiung entschlüsseln. In diesem Herrenhaus müssen sie ein kostbares Artefakt aufspüren, das auf eine rätselhafte Weise besonders wichtig für die Bewahrer des Kristallorakels ist. Und zugleich scheinen das Artefakt wie auch die Prophezeiung untrennbar mit dem Schicksal des ehemaligen dalmarischen Herzogtums verbunden zu sein. Es erscheint fast wie ein Wunder, dass nicht bereits andere Parteien hinter diesem Kleinod her sind…

boardgame.name: Birth ME Code
boardgame.description:
Your goal in this game is to kill me.

That's what they all heard. All nine of them heard this through their helmets. Of course, Pandora was part of the group. One of the nine. She, too, heard those words; those words she spoke in order to fool all of them.

But what is her actual goal here? Where everyone wants to kill Pandora, she wants to kill someone else. She wants to kill the traitor. It's a meticulous plan, all leading to these six deadly hours. It would be funny if it wasn't so morbid.

Pandora is the mastermind. This isn't about finding her; this is about finding the traitor. There are no innocents here, only criminals. And you're one of them. Welcome to My Emptiness.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: The New Marvel-Phile (Issue 47)
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

As a follow-on to not only the 2019 Nova Corps Annual as well as Keith A Kilburn and David Gallaher's awesome New Warriors books, we present this month's New Marvel-Phile, featuring some of Nova's classic enemies!

boardgame.name: Der Pakt der HexenkÃ¶nigin
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

„In den Landen der blutigen Axt, westlich des schwankenden Throns, wo das Kronland dem alten Herzen weicht, hat sein Weg begonnen. Jenseits des Tores, hinter dem gläsernen Tor, auf dem Pfad neben dem Pfad, hat es seine Wahl getroffen. An der verlorenen Küste, in der alten Stadt unter neuem Banner, hinter dem schimmernden Bogen in den Bergen aus Silber, wird es sein Schicksal finden.“

—Weisspruch der Hekaria, Caleria, neuzeitlich

Die Schleier haben sich gelüftet, ein machtvoller Feind ist gefallen und nun ist Lanara unterwegs, um die alte Ordnung zu zerschmettern und Heilung oder Verderben zu bringen, wie es einst geweissagt wurde. Die Abenteurer, deren Schicksal seit ihrer ersten Begegnung mit dem der jungen Frau verknüpft ist, gehen, an ihrer Seite oder auf ihren Fersen, auf eine Reise, die sie weit über die Grenzen von Lorakis in eine zwischen strahlenden Farben, grellem Licht und tiefer Finsternis zerrissene Welt führen wird – ins Herz eines Geheimnisses, das die Götter vor Urzeiten verbargen und das ein seit fast tausend Jahren wirkender Pakt vor dem Zugriff finsterer Mächte schützt.

Der Pakt der Hexenkönigin ist der Abschluss einer Trilogie, die mit Der Fluch der Hexenkönigin (Abenteuer Nr. 1) begann und in Das Kind der Hexenkönigin (Abenteuer Nr. 16) fortgesetzt wurde. Es spielt unmittelbar nach den Ereignissen des zweiten Teils. Auch in diesem Band werden die beiden möglichen Ausgänge von Der Fluch der Hexenkönigin und die daraus folgenden Entwicklungen berücksichtigt.

boardgame.name: Plata
boardgame.description:
Plata is a climbing card game where players enter an abandoned mine in the ghost town of Silver City in search for Plata (silver).
The goal is to win Plata cards, the only ones that score points. The lower the card, the more points it provides.
Players also must be aware of the Mine’s Curse that prevents the last player to leave the mine (to go out of the round) to score any of the points earned during the round.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: H.D.P.: Se viene el Apocalipsis
boardgame.description: Micro expansion with 9 (1 black + 8 white) new cards.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: H.D.P. â€“ Hasta Donde Puedas

boardgame.name: LIGHT: Forge - A Second Skin
boardgame.description:
Picking up the armor piece from the chest the chatter of your pulse slows to the rhythm of the smith’s hammer. Your wounds barely register as you focus on it’s warmth through your gloves.
You find the maker’s mark. Nicked, scuffed, and worn but recognizable nonetheless. You realize you’ve been holding your breath.

LIGHT: Forge provides rules for random armor drops and Tailored legacy pieces~

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: LIGHT: Aethereal - Abandoned But Not Turned
boardgame.description:
Abandoned by the Light, Beacons mostly know them as marauders trying to take it back by force. As in all things, nothing is absolute. Some fight alongside Beacons, or at least in parallel, holding to the philosophy of the Light hoping to earn it back.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: LIGHT: Boreal - Biting Cold
boardgame.description:
Adding a new Elemental Stat alongside Pyre, Volt, and Nether... Boreal stands for the shadows that LIGHT casts.

Custom Boreal Stat rules and new Powers for each the Colossus, Stalker, and Wych classes of LIGHT as well as the Aethereal of LIGHT: Aethereal.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: LIGHT: Awakening
boardgame.description:
WALK THE PATH OF LIGHT & SHADOW

Not all residents of the Lighthouse are Human - some are beings formed from Light and Dark, created from a horrific interstellar rift. Many remain in their new home within the Shoal of Dreams, but some have come to the Lighthouse to offer aid. A few have even received the Light and become Beacons. These strange beings do not all worship the Light and do not all shun the Dark. They are Penumbral.

LIGHT: Awakening is a fan-created module for Spencer Campbell rules-lite sci-fi RPG LIGHT. It introduces several new concepts to LIGHT:


A new playable species - the ethereal, mysterious Penumbral.
Traits, abilities that can be used before or during a Strike unique to each species.
Tags, a form of skills that each character gains by choosing a unique set of Origins, Memories, and Beliefs. Tags can provide a bonus die on any action they apply to. As characters grow and change, these tags can be altered to reflect that growth.
The Shoal of Dreams, a briefly-described location which can be added to your game and visited or fleshed out at the GM's discretion..


Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: LIGHT: Uploaded
boardgame.description:
YOUR SPIRIT LIVES ON IN AN ENGINE OF WAR

The most striking residents of the Lighthouse are no longer Human. They are machines, their origins lost to history and their memories even hazier than other Beacons. Their bodies speak to purposes as warriors, but why and to what end? Where did they come from? Who made them? The Lighthouse has taken them in and in exchange they fight to defend those they once were. They are Eidolons.

LIGHT: Uploaded is a fan-created module for Spencer Campbell's rules-lite sci-fi RPG LIGHT. It introduces several new concepts to LIGHT:


A new playable species - the mechanical, undying Eidolons.
Traits, abilities that can be used before or during a Strike unique to each species.
Tags, a form of skills that each character gains by choosing a unique set of Origins, Memories, and Beliefs. Tags can provide a bonus die on any action they apply to. As characters grow and change, these tags can be altered to reflect that growth.
Mastaba, the Rimed Forge, a briefly-described location which can be added to your game and visited or fleshed out at the GM's discretion.


Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: LIGHT: DORMANCY
boardgame.description:
Living in the Lighthouse, and holding society together is about more than going on missions, sometimes you have to just sit back and have a good meal, with good friends, and DORMANCY attempts to fill some of that void.

This is an unofficial module for Spencer Campbell's incredible rules-lite sci-fi RPG, LIGHT. It introduces 3 new downtime activities (cooking, fishing, and smithing), new minigames, 3 new micro-factions, 3 new locations/missions, 2 new weapon types, 5 new weapon tags to expand on LIGHT: VULCAN, 8 new legendary weapons, and a handful of lore.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Echoes From The Past
boardgame.description:
As long as a Beacon walks within the Light, they are never truly alone. As the saying goes, a Beacon wields the Light on one side, and their Echo on the other.

ECHOES FROM THE PAST is a supplement for the rules lite rpg, [FAMILY=69404] by Gila RPGs. This supplement adds the Beacon's best friend: the Echo. A levitating AI that is made from the memories of dead Beacons. The four pages of this module include:


Information about Echoes and their relationships with the Beacons.
Rules for creating your own Echo.
6 adventure ideas that can be used in one-off adventures or as part of a longer campaign.


Source: https://marianchilde.itch.io/echoes-from-the-past.

boardgame.name: Reaper's Edge
boardgame.description:
You are a Reaper. Once you were a hero of the world, but then you learned the terrible truth: this world is rotting away, and only by putting it out of its misery can a new one be born.

Reaper's Edge is a rules-lite roleplaying game based off of 2400 by Jason Tocci, This project is still in development, though for an experienced Game Master there is enough content that you should be able to easily run a few sessions of it.

Development is going to continue to provide more spells and artifacts, a small bestiary describing some of the world's inhabitants, various tables and resources to make the setting your own, and additional play advice. The goal is to retain the single sheet of rules, but to have enough resources to easily run a full campaign (between 6 and 12 sessions).

Source: https://marianchilde.itch.io/reapers-edge.

boardgame.name: For Words
boardgame.description:
For Words is played with a deck of cards, most showing a single letter. There are also some wild cards and blank cards.

The game starts with each player having five cards and two on the table. On their turn a player must add a single card to the table to form a new word. Cards can be played before, after, in between, or on top of the current cards. Blank cards can be played on top of letters to effectively erase them.

If a player can't play they draw until they can.

The object is to either play all your cards or force the other players to have at least ten. The game is normally played in multiple rounds with scoring.

boardgame.name: Mons, 1914: The Mad Minute
boardgame.description:
On August 3rd, 1914, Germany declared war on France. German armies poured into France and Belgium. Britain protested, then declared war on Germany on August 4th. The famous British Expeditionary Force (BEF) was sent to France and marched into Belgium on August 21st. They halted on the Condé Canal at Mons to defend against what they thought was a small German force to their north. Once that was brushed aside, they planned to turn east and roll up the German flank. However, they actually faced the entire German 1. Armee. The next morning, in a thick mist, German cavalry patrols stumbled into outlying British pickets. So began the long fight between the British and Germans in The Great War.

The Battle of Mons (August 23rd-24th, 1914) looms large in the legends of the British Army. Here the plucky BEF with their “rifle fire like machine guns” gave the dastardly Germans a bloody nose, or so the story goes. The Germans for their part were well satisfied. In their view, they met the “English,” pushed them back, then chased them all the way to the Marne. Which view is correct?

Mons had surprises for both armies. They expected a battle like in The Boer War or the Franco-Prussian War. Mons did have maneuver and even cavalry charges, but hard lessons were learned.

Mons, 1914: The Mad Minute is the second game in the Rifle and Spade Series, first used in Gallipoli, 1915: Churchill’s Greatest Gamble. The series rules have been completely overhauled to speed play and ease learning. Key charts have been simplified and rules that were rarely used have been dropped, resulting in faster and smoother games. Gallipoli can be played with the 2.0 rules with some short upgrade instructions and a few replacement charts.

Mons is a big game. Two maps show the length of the Condé Canal. The 1,500 counters have every unit from the BEF and the German 1. Armee. Units are half-battalions and batteries with some platoon pickets. Mons has many scenarios: three training scenarios, the full two-map historical scenario, several smaller one-map scenarios, and a set of very interesting hypothetical meeting engagements. In the meeting engagement scenarios, the armies enter gradually, led by their cavalry divisions. A wild period of maneuver follows as the cavalry and jägers attempt to sneak past the enemy until the infantry show up, and the battle is joined in earnest. There are rules for cavalry charges, including debacles and impetuous charges. The command problems of the BEF and German 1. Armee are shown, although scenario variants give players all the freedom they could want.

Components:
Two 22x34 maps
5 1/2 standard counter sheets (280 each), total 1,540 counters.
35+ Small wooden colored cubes
One version 2.0 series Rule Book
One Game Book
One Setup Book
Numerous Charts and Tables, Player Aids, Army Organization Trees, and Status Displays
Planning Maps
Dice

-description from publisher's website
