Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Potions & Puppies
boardgame.description:
Potions & Puppies is a light weight game that has a unique twist on resource management and press your luck. It's a 1 to 5 player cooperative game where all players must work together to share resources to discover recipes to a variety of potions to help you get past tasks inside the tower. Each puppy has a unique magic ability to help their friends but must balance using their own abilities with using those same crystals for potions.

Puppies have a variety of actions to take on their turn ranging from gathering crystals from a shared stash to discovering or brewing potion recipes. Each puppy also has two unique abilities - a lesser ability can be used an unlimited number of times per game as well as a once per game ultimate ability that will make the puppy's player mat flip and their remaining ability will cost more gems to use for the rest of the game. Discovering potions is vital to puppies' success, and each time a player wants to discover a potion they must use three colors of crystal from in front of them that do not match any other current recipe before flipping over the top potion card. Potions can be be brewed by using the same crystals as are on the recipe card by placing them onto the puppies' current tile. When all potions have been brewed, the puppies can move forward.

Brewing a potion that is labelled on the modular tile they are currently standing on allows the group to move forward and one step closer to escape. They also have unique abilities such as rearranging recipes, looking at the potion deck to see what is coming up next, and digging up many crystals at once. At the end of each turn the active player can draw up to two crystals from the blind bag to replenish their resources - but each time a black crystal is drawn the guardian moves one space closer to the puppies and the crystal goes back into the bag. If the puppies brew all the potions on the final tile before the guardian lands on their current space - they win! Otherwise, it's game over.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Handegg
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Count Leopold was never the sort to be accused of wisdom nor kindness. He abused his people, overworked the fields, betrayed his men, and to his many wives was a veritable bluebeard of an ogre.

He languishes in his fortress now, old as dust and vile as a putrid fungus. No company save for the wailing cries of his many children, malformed gluttons born from his psyche rather than any lover’s womb.

In the hamlet of Handegg, the people are dying. They seek vengeance, to slay their foul master and appoint a newer, less unkind soul to rule over them. But food is low, morale even lower, and all fear what the Count may do to them next.

HANDEGG is a one page setting for use with most anything, ostensibly designed for use with TROIKA! by way of KRIEGSMESSER. It is just a fun little location to throw down anywhere, filled with several pastoral randomizers; useful as a tiny site for an uprising against a cruel tyrant, or as a mere road stop on the way to further adventure.

boardgame.name: Ruse it!
boardgame.description:
Ruse it! is similar to Perudo: players roll concealed dice and then make ascending bids until someone calls. Its main differentiator is that players can stop the bidding and guess exactly how many of a particular number have been rolled, in order to get lost dice back.

While the game can play up to twelve, each set only supports four.

The game was published under the name BellRose Inc.

boardgame.name: 1-2-3 Cthulhu
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The 1-2-3 Cthulhu role-playing game is set in a modern world of supernatural horror, science fiction and insanity, with a touch of tragic comedy. It was heavily inspired from the game Call of Cthulhu, based on the writings of H.P. Lovecraft. Think of a mixture of The X Files, Edgar Allan Poe, Ghost Busters, The Twilight Zone, Scooby Do, zombie movies, ghost stories, H.G. Wells, Buffy and Ringu.

In 1-2-3 Cthulhu, you play a group of investigators in paranormal phenomena. It is a world where you may encounter strange creatures of the night, ancient spirits and godlike creatures from outer space – a world of occult magick, weird science and horrific dimensions of space-time the human mind is too fragile to understand.

boardgame.name: Power Play
boardgame.description:
Power Play is an abstract hockey-themed game. Each person controls three hockey players, numbered 1-3.

On a turn the owner's players must each be moved to an empty adjacent space if possible, and they must be moved in numerical order. After that, the puck is checked to see how many of the current players are adjacent to it, and it is moved that many spaces in any combination of directions.

Moving the puck into the opposing goal scores a point. The first player to score three points wins.

boardgame.name: LIGHT: Threshold
boardgame.description:
Torches are lights that cast deep shadows.

Not all who wield the Light choose to walk under its glow. THRESHOLD presents a new alternate class to the core three present in LIGHT; the Torch, one who wields the Light but refuses to be bound by the same rules and conventions as Beacons.

LIGHT: Threshold is a module for the rules-lite modular sci-fi RPG LIGHT.


Play as a new class; the TORCH.
Build new combinations of weapons with new weapon tags and curated rolls.
Find new legendary weapons of ill repute.


Now includes a set of Boreal compatible powers for the Torch plus two new Legendary Weapons and an ice-tinged weapon tag. Check out LIGHT: Boreal by Kevin Thien Vu Long Nguyen for all the Boreal rules and more powers.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Sewers & Slimebeasts
boardgame.description:
Sewers & Slimebeasts is written by Abe Crow and published in NorthCoast Roleplaying (Issue 1 - 1987). A two-page comic introduces the game, which is then presented in six pages of rules including the maze-like playing board and a tracking sheet.

The game is played by two opponents, one controlling the "human" team and one controlling the "slimebeast" team. A third player acts as a "referee" to enforce the rules, make decisions in uncertain cases, and track locations and events that are unknown to one team. Additionally, the "referee" controls a team of "bums" - hapless humans that should be rescued by the human team or used as egg incubators by the slimebeast team (bums are, effectively, an in-game resource).

Prior to play, each player receives 100 points to use to build their team. Humans and slimebeasts have variable powers with varying costs; every human and every slimebeast can some varying powers, depending on player desires.

During play, each player maintains their own map that shows locations and events known to them (generally, all their own team and those of the opposing team they have discovered). The play pieces are straight pins with colored tape to indicate status/condition/etc. The referee simultaneously maintains a "master" map that is considered authoritative in the event of a discrepancy with a player map.

Play proceeds in turns following an established sequence. In each turn, humans move first and slimebeasts move second; combat then occurs wherever humans and slimebeasts have encountered each other. Combat uses a fairly complex series of processes that obviously are heavily derived from Dungeons & Dragons mechanics.

The game ends when the humans eliminate the slimebeasts or the slimebeasts eliminate the humans.

—user summary

boardgame.name: LIGHT: Specters
boardgame.description:
As a Beacon, you are a paragon of the Light and a guardian of peoples everywhere. You have access to awesome abilities, an array of impressive armaments, and an entire city supporting you. Still, there is more the Light has to offer you. Specters are entities of pure Light. They are remarkably small representations of the Light’s power in our world but can help a Beacon connect with the Light in ways no Beacon could alone.



LIGHT: Specters is a companion supplement for Gila RPGs's LIGHT, a rules-light system for playing fantastical sci fi games in the spirit of Destiny. Specters adds new rules for playing with Specters, companions made of pure Light that assist the Beacons by channeling great power for them. This one-page supplement offers rules for creating a Specter, equipping them with powerful attributes, working in the service of the Keepers, and defending Specters from the Exorcists.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Residuum
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Residuum is a post-apocalyptic tabletop RPG where Aliens, Mutants, and what's left of humanity seek to survive on the Earth ravaged by nuclear war, disease, and the fall of civilization.

This book contains the core rules for Residuum, including a robust multi-classing system and idea seeds for the design of homebrew campaigns.

boardgame.name: LIGHT: Shard
boardgame.description:
Some settlements and bases are scattered across the system, but the Lighthouse is home you call it home.

Not everyone has the luxury of living at the Lighthouse. With this module you will rebuild a settlement and defend it from invading forces. It will not be easy, but who said it should be?

LIGHT: Shard is a module for the rules-lite modular sci-fi RPG LIGHT by Gila RPGs


Settle a planet in the system or a barren region on Earth
Defend it from the enemy forces
Complete city building projects
With the help of the Shard explore the nearby region, convert Dark to Light and research new tech


Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Geteilte Wellen
Sundered Waves
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sundered Waves features a jaunt through a pirate’s puzzle-filled dungeon, and is the first release in a new downloadable adventure line!

One-Shots provide single-session adventures designed to fill 3–4 hours of game play. Each includes pregenerated characters to make it easy to jump into the action right away. These aren’t just character sheets, though, they’re beautifully illustrated and fully-developed characters with backstories related to the adventure that make for great cooperative storytelling around your gaming table.

User summary:

The scenario is distributed with several files:

15-page PDF scenario (includes print-and-play components)
4-page PDF chronicle sheet (instructions / tracking sheets)
13-page PDF pregenerated characters (print-and-play)
Art assets (14 JPG image and map files)

boardgame.name: The Shopkeeper
boardgame.description:
Who doesn't love a random loot drop!

Collect unique tokens and redeem them for unique weapons. The Shopkeeper is a module for LIGHT that adds 20 unique weapons (including new weapon tags), a system to acquire them and a tentacled friend.

Grinding may be required.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: LIGHT: Spire
boardgame.description:
The Spire looms overhead. An ever changing tower of machinery of unknown origins. Beacons enter the Spire and seek to defeat the the forces of the dark within. Doing so will grant them access to the Anvils; tools user to craft powerful weapons. But failure will see the Beacons cast out and their rewards snatched away.

Enter The Spire, a challenging tower designed to test Beacons, granting the worthy access to Anvils to craft powerful weapons. Each layer completed gives access to an Anvil, the first defining your weapon reward and each that follows allowing a tag to be added.


Fight through up to 5 layers of encounters


C*raft and enhance a weapon frame at the Anvils found throughout The Spire

Customize your reward as you ascend. The farther you climb the stronger your weapon frame becomes
Reach the Pinnacle to craft a Masterwork Weapon
Risk & reward system: try another layer to improve your reward but risk losing your weapon frame should you fail


Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Android Hunter A
boardgame.description:
Android Hunter A is a new breed of the action platformer, featuring A, an android fighting along side the United Rebellion in an attempt to quell the menacing android uprising and learn the truth behind the mysterious Base Metal.

With the imminent discovery of the enigmatic Base Metal insulating the activity between humans and androids, its contestable power and properties made the idea of coexistence futile. The intrinsic androids began to overtake various man-made environments and creations, establishing their presence in the busy streets of future earth, the endless greenery and universal gifts bestowed unto the world by nature, and even the industrious areas that strove to enhance themselves through the use of robotics. The sluggish advancements were not to be waited on, as the rejuvenating effect that the Base Metal had on the androids was unavoidable; the takeover was just a matter of time…


The story of Android Hunter A takes him to new and unseen places around the world, witnessing secretive underground fortresses, neon lit cities and other vast landscapes. If you’re hungering for an awesome new action platformer that brings the most memorable elements of classic side-scroller shooters of the past and revitalizes them into the current generation of gaming, then Android Hunter A is the game for you

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Rainbow Robin
boardgame.description:
PARKOUR MECHANICS, COLOR SWITCHING AND DISCO DANCING FUSED TO CREATE AN ADDICTING NEW SPIN ON THE ENDLESS RUNNING GENRE!


80s cyberpunk themed synthwave tracks composed by an award winning music producer.
Standard Mode: Hone your skills and complete the game’s Standard Mode to unlock the more challenging Panic Mode.
Panic Mode: Increased intensity, speed and music variation: Completing this mode requires masterful precision.
Character Customization: Collect spectrum coins with each run to unlock and equip groovy skins.
Disco Dancing: With each successful run, you’re rewarded with a Disco Dance celebration.


Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Super Robin!
boardgame.description: Find the coin fragments and escape the ruins!

boardgame.name: LIGHT: Forward
boardgame.description:
Beacon are immortal guardians imbued by light, an the light is composed of many hues.

They shouldn't have memories of their life before becoming a beacon, even the search of such knowledge is forbidden. Nevertheless, something lingers on...a place, something happened… a dissonant spark among the brightness.

Even so, there's only so much you can do in darkness before becoming a part of it.


LIGHT: Forward is module about customizing your immortal guardian.


Choose among 12 character classes or mix-n-match it's parts to create your own
Tables for gear, abilities and powers of each element (Pyro, Volt and Nether)
Memories: tables for past places and events, usable by the player or GM
New Power type: Shadow. The more Dark you have, the stronger it becomes


Heavily inspired by Borderlands, Overwatch and N/A.

boardgame.name: The Shattered Lens: A Light Module
boardgame.description: Descend into the Vault and discover what exactly is happening within this ancient structure in this module for Light. Inspired by the Vault of Glass Raid from the original Destiny, Beacons must fight their way through a swath of enemies, both new and old, to confront the problems at the center of the Vault, and save the Lens from being destroyed forever. Difficult, yet fun, this module hopes to provide the outline for a GM and their squad (probably 2-4 optimally, but, you know, a classic six-person fireteam is sure to work wonders). Fully compatible with other Light modules. Shout-out to Gila RPGs for putting together both the jam and Light, and good luck to the Beacons that seek to unlock the secrets of the Vault.

boardgame.name: 100 Medicine Cabinet Finds
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different things that you would find in a modern day medicine cabinet. Around half are prescription medications while the rest are other various items.

boardgame.name: 100 Assorted Pirate Treasures
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different fancy treasures to shove into that buried treasure chest or throw into the ship’s hold below. This list is also usable for randomly rolling up assorted fantasy treasures. Values are given in gold coins– with rates similar to that of certain popular role playing games. Adjust values as desired.

boardgame.name: Planetary Settlement Map 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Do you have a small space age planetary settlement in your game but no map to go with it? Perfect! Because we have the map for you!

This map collection focuses on a small space age colony with 23 different building locations total. The designer has provided 3 versions of the map- unnumbered, numbered locations, and gridded off (each square equals 15 feet). There's also a blank map key page as well as one filled in with suggested location types.

boardgame.name: 100 Star Age Visions And Dreams
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A collection of 100 different visions/dreams to use in star age role playing settings. These are perfect for a GM that wants to give a psychic character a bit of clue about possible upcoming events… or throw them off if the player is relying on their character’s mystic powers a bit too much. Some of these entries are reasonably normal while others border on the realms of insanity and the weird.

boardgame.name: Belford's Crossing
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Two wooden drawbridges span the deep chasm below. Beneath many layers of cliffs and fog winds a river surrounded by scrub, while higher up a multi-story tavern is built into the cliffs.

Rooms for weary travelers to rest in are provided at the top, and a watchtower overlooks the ravine. Stairs lead further down to the tavern and drinking halls, as well as a few small shops and lit alleyways that wind deeper into the mountain.

Decks look out over the steep cliffs on both sides, while a wine cellar gathers dust next to rooms with giant wheels that lower or raise the drawbridges above.

Adventure Idea

You find a middle-aged man lying on a forest road, clasping his bloody hands over a stab wound in his gut. Lying next to him is the cold body of a golden retriever—you can see the blood where she dragged herself from where she was injured, so she could be close to him when she died.

Left for dead after a brutal robbery by bandits, the man begs you to hunt them down and kill the robbers for what they did. He had been on his way to sell a family heirloom to buy medicine for his mother. Not only did they kill his Lola, they stole his hope of healing his mother as well.

When they left, he heard a woman with fiery red hair and a red-wolfskin cape tell the group that their next stop was the Flying Fish tavern for drinks. She was the one who the bandits gave the heirloom to.

Arriving at the tavern, you hear loud howling coming from two tables of heavily armed teenagers. They are joking about a man and his bitch who was stupid enough to not pay for their protection… But the woman the man described isn’t there.

WHAT’S HAPPENING? The leader of the bandits is a low-level fire mage, who instills the young men with the confidence they need to commit their crimes. She is seductive and charming. In her honor, her followers call themselves the Red Wolves.

While her minions are off getting drunk in the tavern, she is selling the heirloom to an antiquarian on the other side of Belford’s Crossing. If you interrogate the men in the tavern they’ll put up a fight but eventually tell you where she is. If you kill them, you’ll need to ask the other witnesses.

boardgame.name: Dark Fungus Forest
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is an .MP4 video battlemap compatible with any RPG game. The easiest way to use it is to play it on a TV laid flat on top of a low table - 40” TV would be the perfect fit for the gridded versions of my maps (but there's always gridless versions for other TV sizes). You can also use a projector or VTT like Roll20.

boardgame.name: Junkyard Hideout
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is an .MP4 video battlemap compatible with any RPG game. The easiest way to use it is to play it on a TV laid flat on top of a low table - 40” TV would be the perfect fit for the gridded versions of my maps (but there's always gridless versions for other TV sizes). You can also use a projector or VTT like Roll20.

boardgame.name: Adventure Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sometimes you just need a bit of adventure—a dungeon to explore or a few monsters to beat up. The core adventures for AsA are story-based and do not allow you, the player, to go off on your own and just explore. The Adventure Generator will solve that issue and allow you to seek out undocumented adventures. Places that have not yet been detailed can now be entered; ruins lost and unmarked on the map can now be sought out and explored.

boardgame.name: The Brigade: Lady Artesia Scyllos
boardgame.description:
A new warden available as a promo in 2020 through The Campaigner magazine.

Text from the card:
When you hire Lady Artesia Scyllos gain a free upgrade.

boardgame.name: That's So 90s
boardgame.description:
Part of the Ridley's collection - mix and match with the different puzzles, games, and nostalgic toys in this brand!

Containing 200 quiz cards, there are 1000 questions to test even the most knowledgeable 1990s expert!

Fun bar quiz style game split into 10 different categories of 100 questions from the 1990s - sports, movies, music, and much more!

boardgame.name: The Harmony Glade
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Sounds of melody and harmony blend together illustriously in song. Waves of sweet tune, rising and falling. Whistles of joy, chirps of careless peace. Notes sung with purpose, sounds of serenity ring aloud. The glade is alive with vibrant noise, but a new sound interrupts the symphony; invaders with an evil ploy. Harmony Glade is teeming with resource, yet a dark plan is in the works.

boardgame.name: Splittermond Einsteigerbox - Das Abenteuer geht weiter
boardgame.description:
From the back of the box:

Bald tausend Jahre ist es her, dass einer der drei Monde über Lorakis barst und das Reich der Drachlinge in der Katastrophe unterging. Für die Menschen, Alben, Zwerge, Gnome und Varge aber begann unter dem Splittermond ein neues Zeitalter: eines, in dem sie die Ketten ihrer früheren Sklaverei abschütteln und die Meister ihres eigenen Schicksals werden sollten.

Willkommen bei Splittermond!

Splittermond ist ein Fantasy-Rollenspiel. Eine Gruppe von Spielern schlüpft in die Rollen von Splitterträgern – vom Schicksal Auserwählte, in denen ein Teil der mythischen Macht des Splittermonds schlummert. Sie werden uralte Rätsel lösen, die Wildnis des Kontinents erforschen, Intrigen aufdecken, mystische Prophezeiungen erfüllen und sich finsteren Monstren zum Kampf stellen. Sie agieren dabei nicht gegen- sondern als Gruppe miteinander: Spielen Sie die Hauptrolle in immer neuen Geschichten voller Magie, Heldenmut, Tragik und Gefahr! Sei es als gnomischer Zauberer, tapferer Ritter, vargische Kundschafterin oder albischer Heiler: Erzählen Sie Ihre eigene Legende, werden Sie zum gefeierten Abenteurer in der magischen Welt von Splittermond!

Diese Box baut auf der Splittermond Einsteigerbox auf und erweitert die dort enthaltenen Regeln und Hintergründe. So finden Sie in dieser Box nicht nur zusätzliche Abenteurer, weitere spannende Zauber und Meisterschaften sowie eine brandneue Kampagne in den fernen Dschungeln Arakeas, sondern auch Regeln um Ihre Charaktere auf den dritten und vierten Heldengrad zu steigern und sie somit noch mächtiger zu machen!

Zur Nutzung der Erweiterungsbox ist die Splittermond Einsteigerbox nötig.

boardgame.name: Euro Truck Simulator 2 - Heart of Russia
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





User Summary

Drive further into Russia as you explore the heart of the world biggest country: Visit Moscow and beyond - along some of Europe's longest rivers including the 3,531 km Volga and it's 1,500 km tributary Oka. A map full of deep forests, open plains, old towns and modern cargo hubs...

boardgame.name: Splittermond - Aufbruch ins Abenteuer
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

Bald tausend Jahre ist es her, dass einer der drei Monde über Lorakis barst und das Reich der Drachlinge in der Katastrophe unterging. Für die Menschen, Alben, Zwerge, Gnome und Varge aber begann unter dem Splittermond ein neues Zeitalter: eines, in dem sie die Ketten ihrer früheren Sklaverei abschütteln und die Meister ihres eigenen Schicksals werden sollten.

Willkommen bei Splittermond!

Schlüpft in die Rollen von Splitterträgern – vom Schicksal Auserwählte, in denen ein Teil der mythischen Macht des Splittermonds schlummert – und übernehmt damit die Hauptrollen in einer Erzählung, die ihr gemeinsam am Spieltisch erschafft. Löst uralte Rätsel, erforscht die Wildnis des Kontinents, deckt Intrigen auf, erfüllt mystische Prophezeiungen und stellt euch finsteren Monstren im Kampf.

Gemeinsam als Gruppe erlebt ihr Geschichten voller Magie, Heldenmut, Tragik und Gefahr! Sei es als gnomischer Zauberer, tapferer Ritter, vargische Kundschafterin oder albische Klingentänzerin: werdet zum gefeierten Abenteurer in der magischen Welt von Splittermond!

Mit Splittermond – Aufbruch ins Abenteuer legt der Uhrwerk-Verlag in Kooperation mit Pegasus Spiele die beliebte Einstiegsbox in veränderter Form neu auf. Hier erhaltet ihr alles, was ihr für erste Besuche in der Welt Lorakis braucht:

- Ein Weltenband für die Spielleitenden
- Ein Regelheft inkl. Charaktererschaffung zur Erstellung eigener Figuren
- Fünf vorgefertigte Archetypen mit jeweils einem eigenen Soloabenteuer
- Der Kampagnenband "Verschworen" mit drei Abenteuern in der Startregion Arwinger Mark
- Eine Tickleiste aus solider Pappe in A2
- Marker aller Archetypen und NSCs zur Nutzung auf der Tickleiste
- Eine Karte der Spielwelt Lorakis in A2 und jeweils in A3 eine Karte der Arwinger Mark und der Stadt Arwingen
- Ein Würfelset, bestehend aus vier zehnseitigen und zwei sechsseitigen Würfeln
- Handzettel mit Regelkurzübersichten für die Spielenden

boardgame.name: Exploradores
boardgame.description:
In Exploradores, players lead teams of explorers into Mayan temples to find golden and silver skulls for display in their museums.
When removing a skull, the playing field changes, as other tiles slide into place (similar to Candy Crush).
When the board is empty, the player with more valuable tiles wins the game.

boardgame.name: Mi Granja
boardgame.description: Each player has a personal stack of cards with farm animals of different sizes. They draw four of these into their hands (three when playing with three players). One by one, they place a card into the middle, forming a 3x3 grid (4x4 with 4 players). When the grid is complete, players receive one point for each row (orthogonal or diagonal) in which they placed the highest card. Whoever has most points after five rounds, wins the game.

boardgame.name: Los Payasos
boardgame.description: The goal for each player is to be the first one to get their clowns ready for the show. Players take turn to roll a special die, and can flip over two cards with the shown symbol. A player who has all their four clowns face up at the same time, wins a point. When five points have been won, the player with most points wins the game.

boardgame.name: A Death in Space
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is an adventure for Cepheus Engine.

While traveling aboard a luxury liner the travelers are summoned by the captain. A passenger has been murdered in his state room. The passengers aboard the craft are rich, famous or noble. The captain is not prepared to ask questions or make accusations against such people. He needs someone, who is not associated with the cruise line, to do the investigation before the ship reaches port. He makes a generous offer to the travelers to handle the issue delicately.

This is a mystery story for the travelers to solve.

boardgame.name: Fort Torriwatch
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A frontier fort through the seasons.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A set of four 30x30 battlemaps depicting a wooden fort, guarding a road pass near a river.
The map is presented in 4 versions - day, night, winter & destroyed. Interiors are also provided for each of the buildings.

boardgame.name: Sorcerer Class
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The new Sorcerer Class for Labyrinth Lord includes the following:

Class Details, including Spellcasting, Sorcerous Origin, and Evoke Magic;

The following Sorcerous Origins, each with their own special abilities:

Angel-Blood
Demon-Blood
Djinn-Blood
Dragon-Blood
Efreet-Blood
Fairy-Blood
Vampire-Blood

New spells for the Dragon-Blood and Vampire-Blood sorcerers, adapted from spells included in the Dragonborn Race and Necromancer Class booklets.

Designed for use with Labyrinth Lord, easily used with any Old School RPG system!

boardgame.name: 50 Vampire Encounters
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's game day, your party has been invited to dine with a Transylvanian Lord and it's time to roll up some random encounters. The dice rattle, and you feel the adrenaline course through your veins, like adventurerers expeditiously retreating from cries in the night... only to roll - 1d6 vampires again, and your mind blanks...

Don't be that guy. Our new 50 ENCOUNTERS series gives you fifty, yes - FIFTY fun, interesting, often challenging, themed encounters, complete with challenge rating calculations, XP and interesting twists. Your players will think you are a brilliantly creative game master, with no two encounters ever the same.

We'll never tell. It can be our little secret.

boardgame.name: Burst Transmissions, vol. 5
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Burst Transmission is a series of small suggested modifications (“house rules”) and quick-and-dirty mechanics for 2D6 science fiction RPGs such as Cepheus Engine and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG.)

This volume has rules and mechanics for:

“Special” Assignments
Artificial Intelligences
Caves/Caverns
Characteristic Generation Using Playing Cards
Contested Throws
Hit Locations
Holding One’s Breath
Information Quality
Knockdown and Dazing
Medical Drugs
Murder Hoboes
Religiously Devout Characters
Skill Specialization

boardgame.name: Fantastic Careers: Inner Strength
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Who doesn’t want more archetypes? This book expands the archetype options available in Pathfinder Second Edition by drawing from the depths of your PC’s strengths. In addition to traditional archetypes, this book includes archetypes that grant your PC forte spells – focus spells you can further enhance with your archetype feats. Regardless of your character build or play style, the Fantastic Careers series provides options to advance your characters along their unique journeys!

This book consists of 26 pages of 49 archetypes. The 49 archetypes include...

13 traditional archetypes

AEON KEEPER
ASSURED
AUSPICIOUS
AWAKENED
COURAGEOUS
CRUX
DESPERATE ONE
INTUITIVE
PRODIGY
REACTIVE
RECUPERATOR
SURVIVOR
TRANQUIL

36 forte spell archetypes - These archetypes grant you access to a favorite spell that you enhance with your archetype feats.

AGITATE
BANE-BLESS
BEFUDDLE
BURNING HANDS
CHARM
COLOR SPRAY
COMMAND
DÉJÀ VU
DISRUPTING WEAPONS
GOBLIN POX
GREASE
GRIM TENDRILS
GUST OF WIND
HARM-HEAL
HYDRAULIC PUSH
ILLUSORY DISGUISE
JUMP
LIBERATING COMMAND
LOCK
LONGSTRIDER
MAGIC MISSILE
MIRROR IMAGE
NOXIOUS VAPORS
PENUMBRAL SHROUD
PHANTOM PAIN
PUMMELING RUBBLE
RAY OF ENFEEBLEMENT
SANCTUARY
SHATTERING GEM
SHOCKING GRASP
SHOCKWAVE
SNOWBALL
SPIDER STING
TETHER
TRUE STRIKE
SUMMONING

boardgame.name: Avalon's Aethyr War (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Aethyr War is a fantasy take on the worldwide conflict of the Second World War. Take German panzer tanks and add in American GI grunt dwarfs, Nazi elves and dragons trying to take down British bombers and you have Aethyr War.

Fully compatible with Pathfinder, take the plunge and enter the world at war with Aethyr War.

Whole new classes, races and much more, you can explore this crazy world of war and be heroes that saved it.

boardgame.name: Avalon's Aethyr War (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Aethyr War is a fantasy take on the worldwide conflict of the Second World War. Take German panzer tanks and add in American GI grunt dwarfs, Nazi elves and dragons trying to take down British bombers and you have Aethyr War.

Fully compatible with Pathfinder, take the plunge and enter the world at war with Aethyr War.

Whole new classes, races and much more, you can explore this crazy world of war and be heroes that saved it.

boardgame.name: Paths of Devotion I
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This pack include three new subclasses for the Sword Saint. The Way of Kojiro is based in versatile two-handed wielding and defensive fighting. The Way of Muramasa deals greater wounds and exploits them. The Way of Pendragon utilizes luck, inspiration and serves as a shinning beacon during combat.

Also include are two feats, usable with the Sword Saint and the Way of Blue Metal fighter.

boardgame.name: Craghallow Mine (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dawn’s dim light conjures up a chill mist whose phantom tendrils coil amid the trees, to linger upon the thorny brambles and dewy boughs. Another tired blade-stroke descends upon the brush, tearing the wisps into whirling vortices which soon dissipate in the breeze. Your sword arm throbs with the ache of a thousand swings made to carve a path through the Tangled Wood. Over the past few hours, the whooping cries of roving goblin bands have given way to a foreboding silence, broken only by the gentle babbling of a cold forest stream. Twixt the trees, you spy the cavernous maw of a long-abandoned mine, rusted rail tracks leading from it like the forked iron tongue emerging from some monstrous gullet.

This Dungeon Backdrop is designed to work with the Lonely Coast campaign setting but can be easily inserted into almost any fantasy campaign.

boardgame.name: Craghallow Mine (OSR)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dawn’s dim light conjures up a chill mist whose phantom tendrils coil amid the trees, to linger upon the thorny brambles and dewy boughs. Another tired blade-stroke descends upon the brush, tearing the wisps into whirling vortices which soon dissipate in the breeze. Your sword arm throbs with the ache of a thousand swings made to carve a path through the Tangled Wood. Over the past few hours, the whooping cries of roving goblin bands have given way to a foreboding silence, broken only by the gentle babbling of a cold forest stream. Twixt the trees, you spy the cavernous maw of a long-abandoned mine, rusted rail tracks leading from it like the forked iron tongue emerging from some monstrous gullet.

This Dungeon Backdrop is designed to work with the Lonely Coast campaign setting but can be easily inserted into almost any fantasy campaign.

boardgame.name: Craghallow Mine (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dawn’s dim light conjures up a chill mist whose phantom tendrils coil amid the trees, to linger upon the thorny brambles and dewy boughs. Another tired blade-stroke descends upon the brush, tearing the wisps into whirling vortices which soon dissipate in the breeze. Your sword arm throbs with the ache of a thousand swings made to carve a path through the Tangled Wood. Over the past few hours, the whooping cries of roving goblin bands have given way to a foreboding silence, broken only by the gentle babbling of a cold forest stream. This Dungeon Backdrop is designed to work with the Lonely Coast campaign setting but can be easily inserted into almost any fantasy campaign.

boardgame.name: Craghallow Mine (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dawn’s dim light conjures up a chill mist whose phantom tendrils coil amid the trees, to linger upon the thorny brambles and dewy boughs. Another tired blade-stroke descends upon the brush, tearing the wisps into whirling vortices which soon dissipate in the breeze. Your sword arm throbs with the ache of a thousand swings made to carve a path through the Tangled Wood. Over the past few hours, the whooping cries of roving goblin bands have given way to a foreboding silence, broken only by the gentle babbling of a cold forest stream. Twixt the trees, you spy the cavernous maw of a long-abandoned mine, rusted rail tracks leading from it like the forked iron tongue emerging from some monstrous gullet.

This Dungeon Backdrop is designed to work with the Lonely Coast campaign setting but can be easily inserted into almost any fantasy campaign.

boardgame.name: 100 Techno-Babble Devices
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Alphabet Soup is a comprehensive guide to words commonly (and uncommonly) found in games or used by gamers. It provides quick, easy definitions in lexicon form: gaming terms, definitions, historical context, mythological terms. It even gives gamemasters advice on how they can use them in their games. It works like an encyclopedia of random bits, only these random bits are things I think are interesting for gamemasters.

In this particular edition, I've provided a 1d100 chart of techno-babble terms for science fiction games ranging from the atomic age to far future games.

boardgame.name: MTH-07 Laboratory
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You set off to do routine repairs on asteroid MTH-07, and then the station goes into Emergency lockdown and the androids start acting weird…

"Monsters of the Week" is a series of scenario, quick to read and to add to your play nights, whether to complete an ongoing campaign, to start one or simply for a one-shot !
They are not written for a specific system or universe in order to let you modify and develop them at will.

Contains

a quick-to-read plot-hook,
exclusive illustration for the monster,
a description of the creature.



Vous partez faire des réparations de routines sur l’astéroïde MTH-07, lorsque la station se met en Verrouillage d’urgence et que les androïdes commencent à agir étrangement...

"Monsters of the Week" est une série de scénarios rapide à lire et à incorporer dans vos soirées de jeux, que ce soit pour compléter une campagne, en commencer une ou simplement pour un one-shot !
Ils ne sont pas écrits pour un système ou un univers en particulier afin de vous permettre de les modifier et les développer à volonté.

Contient :

une amorce de scénario rapide à lire,
une illustration exclusive du monstre,
une description de la créature.

boardgame.name: OXx
boardgame.description:
OXx is a game system with cards. The rules contain four ways of playing, the publisher has announced that further rule sets would be published on their website.
The cards have three properties: A background color, a word (blue, yellow, etc.) and a color in which this word is written. Most rule sets are based on finding cards with two matching characteristics, you will then try to get rid of them by stacking them up, either player by player or in a speed mode.

boardgame.name: The Golden Road
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You awake in the midst of utter devastation. You recognize neither the land nor sky--which is covered by the dark clouds of a fierce but now-receding storm. You are in the midst of a grassy field but all around you are debris picked up and thrown by some great force--of which you yourselves were a part, apparently.

This now-past storm seems to have had more than merely natural powers for you see not merely natural debris scattered as far as the eye can see. Weird remnants of artificial structures abound: Whole sections of wooden and stone ruins, picked up and thrown, carved arches and shattered columns freshly embedded in the ground, individual bricks, broken sculpture and whole sections of masonry and construction from seemingly a hundred sources lie everywhere.

You must follow the Golden Road. All travelers who were delivered by the great storm before you left upon it and none came back frustrated. Or, really, came back at all. But at the end of the Golden Road lives a wizard we have heard of: A wizard of great power who dresses all in green and likewise lives in a palace entirely of green stone and crystal. He, surely, can help you to return to the place from whence you came.

boardgame.name: Dirge: The Rust Wars
boardgame.description:
Dirge: The Rust Wars is a card-based tabletop skirmish game in a forgotten future that plays in around 30 minutes and features area control, multiple scoring opportunities, and combo-driven actions, with pinch of deck-building.

Each game, players draft two different units, adding those units' cards to their starting deck. Throughout the game, these units are moved around the board — a 4x4 grid of locations, each with their own effects — to attack opposing units and score points, while cards are used to manipulate the game a variety of ways.

The three action cards correspond to the three different unit types — Infantry, Cavalry, and Engine — and along with the turn sequence card, they drive the game through round-based game play in which each player in a round receives three turns, but never the same three actions as the other player.

Players score points for destroying an opposing unit, playing two or more cards during their turn, having both units survive the round, and controlling the vast inland Sawgrass Sea. The game ends when a player has scored 12 or more points at the end of the round, with the player who scores the most points winning.

—description from the publisher

listing.notes: Complete and in perfect condition. $8 shipping.
Played once. Contact me for shipping costs.

boardgame.name: Keyper at Sea
boardgame.description:
Keyper at Sea is an expansion of the game Keyper which includes 2 versions: the Shallow Water game and the Deep Water game, plus solo mode games for both Keyper and Keyper at Sea - Shallow Water by Dávid Turczi.

Keyper at Sea introduces a 'folding' sea board, replacing the country board in the Shallow Water game, but as an additional board in the Deep Water game. The sea board contains additional water spaces and introduces the fish market field.

In addition there is a fish market board, fishing boats, fish fairs, store tiles, sea creatures and treasures.

In the Deep Water game, players complete the seasons on different turns. The first player to complete a season gains a store tile and then plays through that season for a second time. This is an unusual concept which can provide new and interesting game challenges. Keyper at Sea presents players with more scoring opportunities than in the base game of Keyper and players are likely to be able to score achieve higher scores.

—description from the publisher

listing.notes: Unplayed. Ships cheaply.
Title: Keyper at Sea (Kickstarter Version) Publisher: R&D Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: De KÃ¶lsche Zigg
boardgame.description:
This is a game about Cologne in the Middle Ages designed to pass on the forgotten or buried knowledge. It was originally intended for graduates of the Akademie för uns Kölsche Sproch, who took their diploma there in the form of a knowledge quiz.

Players roll dice to visit Cologne's historical sights, but they can only move further after they have answered a question correctly. There are a total of 451 questions. The winner is the player who have visited all the sights and put down the corresponding card.

boardgame.name: Keyper: Leader
boardgame.description:
The Leader country tile was published as a Kickstarter stretch goal for Keyper at Sea.

When a player places a keyple on the Leader country tile, it enables them to additionally play two same-coloured (or white) keyples onto another tile or field and get double the actions or rewards. As a consequence a player can play their team of keyples more quickly and profitably than would otherwise be possible, but are then also likely to have fewer different types of laydown actions to choose from. The leader is a very strong country tile, but is tricky to play optimally and its inclusion should be agreed by all players before starting a game of Keyper or Keyper at Sea.

The Leader was not included in the base games as a regular tile as it seriously disrupts the normal flow of a game. Full details can be found in the files section. It is part of a punchboard in the Keyper at Sea box.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: ArrÃ¡strame al Infierno
boardgame.description:
Arrástrame al Infierno es el segundo módulo oficial en la línea Casebook para el juego de género negro Hardboiled. Los casebooks son aventuras investigativas de distinto género y estilo.

En esta ocasión nuestros personajes deberán investigar la misteriosa desaparición de Sharon Miller, hija de Gloria Miller, una actriz de Hollywood venida a menos. Según se desvelan las incógnitas alrededor del caso, los investigadores deberán enfrentarse a la maldad humana, una prueba que bien podría arrastrarles al infierno de la locura.

boardgame.name: Snuff Movie
boardgame.description:
Sobre el proyecto 12 actualizaciones Comunidad
CUATRO MÓDULOS PARA EL JUEGO DE ROL DE GÉNERO NEGRO HARDBOILED

Hardboiled es el juego de género negro editado por el Grupo Creativo de la Marca del Este y lanzando mediante campaña de crowdfunding hace algo más de tres años. Inspirado por los clásicos de la literatura, como Dashiell Hammett o Raymond Chandler, Hardboiled abarca mucho más, recogiendo en su haber la novela policíaca, criminal y detectivesca más clásica, desde el Sherlock Holmes de nuestro querido y admirado Conan Doyle, hasta el flemático Poirot de Christie, pasando por el Auguste Dupin de Poe, el Maigret de Simenon, el sin par Padre Brown de Chesterton, incluso el Ripley de Highsmith, entre otros muchos, destacando si cabe, a los más aguerridos y duros investigadores del noir, encuadrados en el subgénero hard-boiled, que escogimos en su día como título para el juego, como Sam Spade, Philip Marlowe, el violento y expeditivo Mike Hammer, Race Williams, Lew Archer, etc.

Hardboiled nos permite recrear todo tipo de historias, inspiradas en diferentes corrientes literarias dentro del género, desde la tan en boga novela negra escandinava, con autores como Camilla Läckberg, Stieg Larsson o Henning Mankell, hasta la novela de espionaje más clásica de John le Carré o Ludlum, pasando por los cientos de autores presentes en docenas de países de todo el mundo, sin olvidarnos de los escritores patrios, que descollan por su calidad, como Manuel Vázquez Montalbán y su inolvidable Pepe Carvalho, Lorenzo Silva (autor del prólogo de Hardboiled), Alicia Giménez Bartlett, Alexis Ravelo, Cristina Fallarás, Andreu Martín o Francisco González Ledesma.

Es decir, Hardboiled tiene un afán no disimulado de trascender fronteras, estilos y subgéneros dentro de la novela negra, permitiéndonos, incluso fomentando, que podamos situar nuestras aventuras en el país que queramos y en nuestra época preferida, emplazando los casos dentro de la corriente literaria que más encaje con nuestros gustos, sea la novela detectivesca clásica, o la más reciente novela policíaca procedimental, el thriller político, la intriga criminal, la ficción de misterio típica del subgénero cozy británico, las conspiraciones políticas o el espionaje internacional.

Como todos saben, Hardboiled fue editado gracias a una exitosa campaña de mecenazgo habilitada en este mismo portal hace ya unos años. Ahora es nuestra intención relanzar la línea añadiendo cuatro nuevos módulos (*casebooks*) y una pequeña tirada del manual original con las erratas corregidas, habida cuenta de que este libro está descatalogado a día de hoy.

Junto con el manual básico de Hardboiled, apareció en la campaña la primera aventura en la línea Casebook, escrita por Pedro Gil, con el título de Cloroformo.

Como ya hemos apuntado, ahora pretendemos con este crowdfunding editar cuatro nuevos módulos o casebooks de aventuras dentro de la línea Casebook para el juego, que son los siguientes:
ARRÁSTRAME AL INFIERNO

Arrástrame al Infierno es el segundo módulo oficial en la línea Casebook para el juego de género negro Hardboiled. Los casebooks son aventuras investigativas de distinto género y estilo.

En esta ocasión nuestros personajes deberán investigar la misteriosa desaparición de Sharon Miller, hija de Gloria Miller, una actriz de Hollywood venida a menos. Según se desvelan las incógnitas alrededor del caso, los investigadores deberán enfrentarse a la maldad humana, una prueba que bien podría arrastrarles al infierno de la locura.

Este módulo ha sido escrito por José Carlos de Diego.

Aquí tienen algunos de los pliegos ya maquetados de esta aventura:

SNUFF MOVIE

Snuff Movie es el tercer módulo oficial en la línea Casebook para el juego de género negro Hardboiled.

En este caso encarnaremos a dos duros detectives de la División de Investigaciones Criminales de la Policía Estatal de Luisiana, en la actualidad, enviados a investigar una serie de extraños sucesos relacionados con la desaparición de Naomi Bourgeois en el corazón de la región cajún. Los detectives se verán envueltos en una turbia trama de corrupción, rituales sacrílegos, pederastia y elementos de brujería, inmersos de lleno en el sórdido mundo tejido en derredor de macabras snuff-movies, reproducidas en reuniones clandestinas.

boardgame.name: El hombre que sabÃ­a demasiado
boardgame.description:
El hombre que sabía demasiado es el cuarto módulo oficial en la línea Casebook para el juego de género negro Hardboiled.

Al inspector jefe de Scotland Yard, Seamus Kavanagh, le asignan un enigmático caso relacionado con la aparición de un hombre ensangrentado que deambulaba sin sentido por el distrito de St. James, quien no recuerda quién es, dónde vive y qué ha hecho las últimas horas. No tardará todo en complicarse para el astuto y veterano inspector, que se verá envuelto en una turbia trama de espionaje y terrorismo internacional en el convulso Londres de 1891.

boardgame.name: Encounters with the Dark Powers
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Make death meaningful and remarkable with these twenty roleplay encounters!

boardgame.name: No me lleves lejos
boardgame.description:
No me lleves lejos es el quinto módulo oficial en la línea Casebook para Hardboiled.

En este nuevo caso los investigadores deberán resolver un secuestro en la España rural de los años 20. En el papel de policías de una capital de provincia, recibiremos la orden de nuestros superiores para investigar el secuestro del hijo de un poderoso terrateniente de un pueblo cercano. La Guardia Civil de la zona ya tiene un sospechoso, pero algo nos dice que este caso no tendrá una resolución tan fácil...

boardgame.name: Blood, Salt & Bones
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Two dozen fantastical ships and the sailors who crew them.

boardgame.name: Aloha, muÃ±eca
boardgame.description:
Aloha, muñeca es el sexto módulo oficial en la línea Casebook para el juego de género negro Hardboiled. Los casebooks son aventuras investigativas de distinto género y estilo.

En esta interesante y peculiar aventura, con una estructura especial que hará las delicias de los aficionados al género más clásico, deberemos viajar hasta la hermosa Hawaii durante los convulsos años 70 para resolver un enrevesado caso que puede tornarse en todo un desafío mortal para los investigadores.

boardgame.name: Jan 22, 2021
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Map Theme: Guard Outpost

Each Free Map Friday ZIP contains five 5100x3300 pixel (600 dpi) high-resolution versions of a single dungeon map. Those versions include:


1. Virtual Tabletop (VTT) Map
2. Player Map (With Grids)
3. Player Map (Without Grids)
4. GM Map

boardgame.name: Jan 29, 2021
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Map Theme: Lair of the Council of Eight

Each Free Map Friday ZIP contains five 5100x3300 pixel (600 dpi) high-resolution versions of a single dungeon map. Those versions include:


1. Virtual Tabletop (VTT) Map
2. Player Map (With Grids)
3. Player Map (Without Grids)
4. GM Map

boardgame.name: Feb 05, 2021
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Map Theme: Mountain Shrine

Each Free Map Friday ZIP contains five 5100x3300 pixel (600 dpi) high-resolution versions of a single dungeon map. Those versions include:


1. Virtual Tabletop (VTT) Map
2. Player Map (With Grids)
3. Player Map (Without Grids)
4. GM Map

boardgame.name: Skull Tales: Tortuga Expansion
boardgame.description:
Splice the mainbrace, seadogs and landlubbers, and welcome to Tortuga! A new expansion for Skull Tales: Full Sail! with many challenges for your heroes. Roam the streets of Tortuga in search of rumors, meet bizarre and mysterious new characters, like the dark Papa Ghede and his black magic, or Stan the charlatan merchant... Tackle the
Brotherhood’s challenges and their new assignments for their captains, and sail through Caribbean waters to discover new keywords in the Voyage Cards.

So get your crew ready and weigh anchor to discover these 110 new cards for Skull Tales: Full Sail! (core game required to play this expansion).

This expansion includes (You can shuffle these new cards with the decks of the game):


40 Voyage Event cards.
8 Rumor cards.
7 Assignment cards.
55 Port cards (11 per Location).


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: A Spluttering And A Splashing
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Ancient legends tell of a creature with supernatural powers that is able to stop the apocalypse. The Archbishop of the Church of the Rotten Swamp discovers a map that was thought to be lost, showing the way to the creature's lair. You are sent to explore the cave and its secrets.

"A Spluttering And A Splashing" is a MÖRK BORG dungeon created for the FÖLK-LORE jam.

boardgame.name: Flock of Fame
boardgame.description:
A fast paced card game where you build your own coop of famous chickens to lay the most eggs. Attempt to form cliques of hens or pair them with roosters for bonus points. Stop your opponents progress with downgrades and predators, while protecting your chickens and upgrading you coop. Beware of climate change and deadly outbreaks that unexpectedly change the course of the game. You never know when a hen may be lure away or your free range upgrade stolen, as you fight until the last card is laid! Its a squawking good time.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Mysteries Unwrapped
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Danger Room Encounters are combat simulations that combine realistic illusions, hard-light holograms, and matter re-materialization to simulate virtually any environment that offers benefits to both GMs and players. A session in Danger Room Encounters allows heroes to practice their skills and powers without worrying about property damage or bystanders. Heroes can try alternate uses of their powers and experiment with how far they can push those abilities. Danger Room Encounters serves as an excellent, easy way to introduce new players to the game by helping them learn the rules one step at a time.

Mysteries Unwrapped occurs in the setting of the Ardham University Museum of History and the Arts. Within this Danger Room, the Team are required to locate a string of mystical relics before the deranged Witch Hunter Universal can use them to unleash the otherworldly terror, Mlougnned, the Hideous Maw of the Goat Lord.

boardgame.name: Harvest Crunch
boardgame.description:
It's harvest season! Put your tractors to work, be savvy and cash in your valuable crops at the end of harvest to finish on top! In this card drafting game, you must judge the market and predict what your fellow farmers will do as you try to collect the best hand of valuable crops!

Harvest Crunch takes the card drafting of Sushi Go! and gives it a twist, as different types of crops are worth different amounts each round. Select valuable crops and cash them in but, only if you can sell them before your opponents take up all the room in the elevators! To guarantee you can sell your crops, collect tractors. If you have the most tractors you get to sell your crops first!

Collecting combines doubles the amount you receive for crops. Collecting silos allow you to save crops until they are at their most valuable. Have the most money by the end of the game to win!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Explorers
EXPLORERS
boardgame.description:
From puiblisher blurb:

Explorers is a supplement for Cepheus Engine and for the gritty HOSTILE science fiction setting.

It provides all of the tools the explorer needs to tackle dangers and exotic encounters on remote worlds. Included within the book is a fully detailed survey ship, the USCS Castle Bravo; an in-depth look at both the Tharsis Armadillo All-Terrain Vehicle as well as the explorer’s habitat of choice: the Leyland-Okuda modular base series. The space suits of the HOSTILE universe are also featured, with a set of customisable options.

Finally, survey and exploration procedures are explained with advice and rules provided which will allow the referee to create a tense, unpredictable and (hopefully!) dangerous survey mission. These come with 36 uninhabited world descriptions for use in your game.

Deckplan for the ATV
Deckplan for 9 modular base variants
Deckplan for the 300-ton survey ship, Castle Bravo
The state of exploration today
How to game a planetary expedition
36 world descriptions for exploration use
Hex charts for your use
Vacc suits in depth, with 3 full colour full page adverts

boardgame.name: Bloom
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

At a dark corner of colonised space, a secretive research lab has discovered something miraculous. Something horrifying. Something voracious.

A 4-6 hour adventure for use with the MOTHERSHIP Sci-fi Horror RPG system, Bloom explores the terror of discovering one may be contaminated and the horror of succumbing to infection.

With Bloom, you'll get:

An overview of Outpost Choi and the Choi Labs, including various maps and handouts.
An overview of the Bloom moss that's spread throughout the facility, as well as the various horrors that it has spawned.
A wonderfully unsettling table for symptoms players will suffer as infection slowly overwhelms them.
6 Pregenerated characters, a team of marine mercenaries, for optional use in the Bloom adventure (or elsewhere!)

boardgame.name: Nirvana on Fire
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The power station on the moon Bodhisattva 2a is nearing the end of its lifecycle and without it, the small Zen colony established there will freeze to death. Abbot Benz-Shiroyuki requests aid. He is willing to give over salvage rights to the decommissioned and heavily damaged terraforming tower at the top of the space elevator to any willing to print a working power converter in the Manufactory and deliver it to the colony.

The catch? In his post, the Abbot neglected to mention that the tower’s AI, Aishi, believes itself to be a manifestation of the deity Mahakala, lord of time, death and destruction who doesn’t take kindly to intrusions into its sanctum.

Nirvana on Fire is a licensed, third-party supplement for the Mothership RPG that contains everything you need for a night of horror among the stars. It has been carefully designed to provide GMs with an efficient, table-ready document that is low on fluff and high on utility so you can get down to gaming. This module can be easily tied into an existing adventure, stand on its own, or become the start of something new. Whatever you do, make it your own and have fun.

What's inside? Everything you need to run a horror-tinged, sci-fi exploration including:

Two unique and vibrant locations; Mahakala’s Terraforming Tower and the Moon Colony of Siddharta’s Peace, each with their own possibilities for ongoing intrigue.
Alternate starting conditions geared for either one-shot or mini-campaign play.
An array of original monsters and NPCs including the unstable, bio-technical horror the Avatar of Mahakala.
A bonus scenario generator in case anyone survives.

boardgame.name: Welcome to ERF
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Enceladus Research Facility sits at the south pole of Saturn's ice moon. But it conceals a mind-bending secret that will change your crew - and possibly all of humanity - forever.

"Welcome to ERF" is a short pamphlet-formatted supplement containing a new mechanic for the influence of a powerful eldritch presence, 10 monsters, an NPC generator, a keyed map for an underground adventure location, and more.

boardgame.name: Harm's Way
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Playable scenario which serves to introduce the Players to the murky underworld of the great metropolis

Provides a simple opening game for Players new to the world of DEGENESIS, including premade characters for them to quickly get into the action and a rules primer to ease newcomers into the KatharSys system

boardgame.name: Cellulose: A Plant Cell Biology Game
Zellulose
boardgame.description:
Cellulose: A Plant Cell Biology Game is a worker placement game that puts 1-5 players inside a plant cell, where they will compete over limited resources in order to undergo photosynthesis, produce carbohydrates, and build the cell wall. With everyone vying for the same actions, players must time their use of proteins, hormones, and cell component cards in order to diversify their strategies and outplay the competition.

Cellulose is the standalone sequel to Cytosis (2017). It has some of the same DNA, but Cellulose expands familiar game systems, allowing players greater control over available resources, strategic paths, and even game length.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Tacocat Spelled Backwards
boardgame.description:
Win duels by playing cards of matching or higher value to defend your hand or sacrifice your lowest card. When you're on your final card, lowest card wins the round bringing Tacocat closer to their side.

Tacocat Spelled Backwards is a fun balance of strategy, luck and instinct! With its portable open-and-play design, it's a perfect two player anytime, anywhere game; the box is the board, just open and play!

What's Included
7 colorful palindrome tiles.
38 delightful and hilariously illustrated palindrome cards with values from 1 to 12 for strategic card match ups.
1 adorable token of Tacocat, the ICONIC character from the Exploding Kittens game.

boardgame.name: The Zodiac Trial
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Several years ago, a man was convicted of murder sentenced to the death penalty.

Now 12 people from that trial have woken up in an empty school with collars on their necks. From the prosecutor to witnesses who were never even called on during the case, someone is out for revenge.

But their captor is fair. He's provided them with a way out: Run the Race of the Chinese Zodiac Animals. The winners live. The losers ... well, let's say there's a penalty.

boardgame.name: Animals in Waistcoats
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Animals in Waistcoats is a lighthearted RPG about charming animal friends inspired by the works of Beatrix Potter and Kenneth Grahame. The perfect game for a cozy one-shot on a lazy Sunday.

The stakes are low, the pace is slow, and a pot of tea is required to play.

boardgame.name: A Dragon Game
boardgame.description:
There are lots of games about dragons and adventure. This is one of them.

Ten pages. Simple rules. Endless fun.

No money goes to Hasbro but you can steal their adventures and use this to play them.

Make stuff for this dragon game without having to pay me royalties, if you want.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: ASL Comp: Gettysburg â€“ Turning Point 1863
boardgame.description:
Gettysburg – Turning Point 1863 the Battle of Gettysburg in tactical-level format for ASLers.

This set gives the player everything needed to play, only ASL-RB and standard system markers are needed.

It offers a set of scenarios that all play on the McPherson's Ridge and Bliss Farm maps.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: ASL Comp: Gettysburg â€“ Into the Wheatfield

boardgame.name: Our God Is Dead
boardgame.description:
Your god has died, but nobody needs to know that! Our God Is Dead is an ultra-light comedy RPG about playing as a group of fantasy devotees who wake up to discover their god has unexpectedly died. Nobody respects the cleric of a dead god and you aren't particularly ready to give up that distinction, the only solution is to create a ruse and fool everyone!

The game is completely GM-less, requires no prep at all, and is played in a single session. So grab your friends, some dice, and a desire for mischief, then prepare to fool everyone into thinking that you're all very respectable people service a god that is very much alive.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Felldom Core Book
boardgame.description:
Felldom, short for Fell Kingdoms, is a game of strategy and competition.

You will pit two or more fantasy armies in brutal mass combat.
If you enjoy rolling buckets of dice and using wit and tactics to best your opponent, this is the game for you.
Fell Kingdom plays off the best parts of older fantasy wargames to make a feeling of nostalgia with every battle.

Don your armor and draw your sword, for the cry of war is sounded once more!

This book includes the core rules to play a game of Felldom, but does not include any army lists.

-description from the publisher

boardgame.name: ASL Comp: Gettysburg â€“ The Battle of Culp's Hill
boardgame.description:
Gettysburg – The Battle of Culp's Hill continues the series and also equips the player with a second edition presentation with all known errata input, plus the bonus counters needed to add more units for playing the scenarios enclosed.

Ownership of ASL Comp: Gettysburg – Turning Point 1863 is required to play.

During the Battle of Gettysburg, July 1–3, 1863, Culp's Hill was a critical part of the Union Army defensive line, the principal feature of the right flank, or "barbed" portion of what is described as the "fish-hook" line. Holding the hill was by itself unimportant because its heavily wooded sides made it unsuitable for artillery placement, but its loss would have been catastrophic to the Union army. It dominated Cemetery Hill and the Baltimore Pike, the latter being critical for keeping the Union army supplied and for blocking any Confederate advance on Baltimore or Washington, D.C.

Scenarios:

Johnson’s Hesitation – Culp’s Hill, Gettysburg, July 1st 1863
Artillery Duel - Culp’s Hill, Gettysburg, July 2nd 1863
Meade’s Blunder - Culp’s Hill, Gettysburg, July 2nd 1863
Before Nightfall - Culp’s Hill, Gettysburg, July 2nd 1863
Pardee’s Field - Culp’s Hill, Gettysburg, July 3rd 1863
Blood “Red Hill” - Culp’s Hill, Gettysburg, July 3rd 1863
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: ASL Comp: Gettysburg â€“ Into the Wheatfield
ASL Comp: Gettysburg â€“ Retro Map 2nd Edition: Devil's Den

boardgame.name: ASL Comp: Gettysburg â€“ Into the Wheatfield
boardgame.description:
Gettysburg, Into the Wheatfield continues the series and also equips the player with a second edition presentation with all known errata input, plus the bonus counter sheet that is needed to add more units for playing the scenarios enclosed.

Scenarios:

Into the Wheatfield – The Wheatfield, Gettysburg, July 2nd 1863
Kershaw’s Attack - The Wheatfield, Gettysburg, July 2nd 1863
Stony Hill - The Wheatfield, Gettysburg, July 2nd 1863
The Stone Wall - The Wheatfield, Gettysburg, July 2nd 1863
Caldwell’s Counter-Attack - The Wheatfield, Gettysburg, July 2nd 1863
The Last Attack - The Wheatfield, Gettysburg, July 2nd 1863
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: ASL Comp: Gettysburg â€“ The Battle of Culp's Hill
ASL Comp: Gettysburg â€“ Turning Point 1863

boardgame.name: ASL Comp: Gettysburg â€“ Pickett's Charge
boardgame.description:
Gettysburg - Pickett's Charge continues the series and also equips you with a second edition rules presentation with all known errata input, plus the bonus counters needed to add more units for playing the scenarios enclosed.

Ownership of Gettysburg: Turning Point 1863 + Culp's Hill + Devil's Den OR Into the Wheatfield is required to play.

Pickett's Charge was an infantry assault ordered by Confederate Gen. Robert E. Lee against Maj. Gen. George G. Meade's Union positions on Cemetery Ridge on July 3, 1863, the last day of the Battle of Gettysburg during the American Civil War.

Scenarios:

Ohio Musketry – Gettysburg, July 3rd 1863
On the Right Flank - Gettysburg, July 3rd 1863
Cushing’s Courage - Gettysburg, July 3rd 1863
Failure to Obey - Gettysburg, July 3rd 1863
Fredricksburg! – “The Angle,” Gettysburg, July 3rd 1863
Pickett’s Charge! - Gettysburg, July 3rd 1863
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: ASL Comp: Gettysburg â€“ Retro Map 2nd Edition: Devil's Den

boardgame.name: Floresta Encantada
boardgame.description:
Call your friends and venture into the Enchanted Forest in search of treasures, but beware, it is full of dangers.


On your turn, discard a character card from your hand and


move your pawn to the next square where there is an icon of that character.

When a player plays a character card that takes him to a space containing a score marker, it collects the score marker from the top of the pile.
The game ends when the last castle token is collected, even if other score markers along the trail have not yet been collected.

boardgame.name: SKOOT: The Do-It-Yourself Biathlon Boardgame
boardgame.description:
SKOOT is a Biathlon game that uses dice for movement and a heart rate meter for strategy. The goal is to find a balance between skiing speed and shooting clean. Miss a target and go to the penalty loop where the benefits of your fast skiing evaporate! Who will cross the finish line first?

The board can be printed and glued together, and you'll need at least 5 dice (8 recommended), the manual and two tokens per player.

boardgame.name: The Tower of the Dreamshadow
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Built into a black shard of death-made-form, this tower and the surrounding region of the Negative Energy Plane are the abode of the Dreamshadow, a being of nightmare and hunger obsessed with growing more powerful by consuming lives and souls. It holds captive many creatures both lowly and mighty, either fed to it by its ally, Orcus, or captured by its minions as their decrepit souls wander terrified in the darkness of the Death Plane.

This module is structured to present a party of characters 18th to 20th level with a tough but survivable challenge; it is optimized for a party of 5 18th-level characters. Ideally, it is used to challenge a high-level party with a quest to recover the soul of a fallen ally which has become trapped in the Negative Energy Plane for a reason appropriate to your campaign. The example presented in this module is Nymurrh the Bronze, an ancient bronze dragon from the Forgotten Realms campaign setting, who in the background of this module was slain by powerful necromancy and became trapped in Dreamshadow’s domain; but any other NPC could easily take his place.

boardgame.name: A Lonely Road to Revolution
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Above the green swamp with thick waters looms the picture-perfect palace of the Elven city 'Porto Verde', in whose vast shadow lies the workers' district of the city. Subconsiously, everyone feels that something is afoot, looming in the dirty and dark alleys of the workers' district. In the distance is the ever-shunned canyon, shrouded in mysterious black fog. A group of adventurers will find themselves in a chain of events that will change the entire city and region forever.

You want to go on a weird mission to recover a magical artefact? You want to play a revolution in an immensely decadent and authoritarian city? You want weird humour by some random German guy (me, the author)? All three?! Well, then here you go! Starting off in the most classical way, waking up in an unkown tavern with no memories from last night, the adventurers will get a seemingly generic quest by a very peculiar orcish barkeeper. Heading of to their quest, the adventurers are not the ones that will come back completely changed, but the city will be! After returning from the journey, harsh desicions have to be made! 'A lonely Road to Revolution' is an opportunity to play a not always too serious, but grown-up adventure with a low-level party.

boardgame.name: Doom on Starspell Mountain
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A streaking comet heralds a wild storm. An ancient temple roars to life with strange and otherworldly chants. Doom is coming to Starspell Mountain. Navigate traps, meet a mad elf, and stop otherworldly threats as you explore the temple on Starspell Mountain.

Doom on Starspell Mountain is a one-shot adventure for 3rd-4th level characters made for the world's greatest roleplaying game. The adventure features traps, simple puzzles, and secret passages.

boardgame.name: Battle of the Bards
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The party finds themselves in an abandoned hamlet that has been ‘pied pipered’ by the powerful fey musician, Dephkon. In a nearby glade, Dephkon has ensnared the villagers in a perpetual dance that can’t be escaped. The party has seven days to bring the greatest bards in the land to challenge Dephkon to a Battle of the Bards.

Battle of the Bards is an adventure for characters of 6th to 8th level.

The adventure takes approximately 4-6 hours of play to complete.

boardgame.name: Devil of a Night
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Can your players heist the Stone of Golorr during an elegant ball? Or will they be swept into the dark designs of the evening’s hosts? Either way, it’s bound to be a Devil of a Night!

Once every year, the nobility of Waterdeep set aside business matters for an evening of entertainments. The Starlit Revels — a name that pales before the true grandeur of these affairs — will this year be held by House Cassalanter. Some believe Victoro's come into possession of the Stone of Golorr, secreting the artifact away in his trophy room. Tonight, when the city’s elite file into Cassalanter Villa, the PCs may not be the only ones mounting a daring heist.

boardgame.name: Twilight at Eventide
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Twilight at Eventide is a 32-page collection of three short adventures designed for characters of level 1-3. In the village of Eventide, the walls separating the settlement from the Feywild are weak. And strange creatures stalk the surrounding forests. Dark forms worship their demigod in hidden caves. A darkling elder has returned to take what was promised to him. And people enter the woods never to return. The village is in need of heroes. Will you answer the call?

boardgame.name: Beyond the Horizon: Oracle
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Embark on your epic solo journey and create your own destiny!

Beyond the Horizon: Oracle is a solo adventure for a level 3 character. No Dungeon Master needed.

A mysterious voice leads you to a rocky island to look for someone. You are not sure what you are expected to do but, when lightning strikes three times from a clear sky, you know that the gods are heavily involved in whatever is happening on the island.

Will you do please the gods or will you defy them? Will you stand up for what you believe is right, even if it could anger the gods?

Whatever you do, choose wisely – your actions will determine what happens at the end of this adventure and in the following chapters!

boardgame.name: La Veglia Notturna
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

La Veglia Notturna è una avventura divisa in capitoli da inserire all'interno delle vostre avventure in città/terre selvagge con ambientazione horror. All'interno troverete 2 nuovi mostri e regole aggiuntive sulla Corruzione del Male e come gestirle all'interno del party.

Gli avventurieri si troveranno faccia a faccia con un gruppo di eroi locali ed insieme dovranno capire perchè il male si fa sempre più forte in quest'area del regno.

Riusciranno a comprendere e scoprire cosa crea questo inestinguibile male senza perire sotto una costante corruzione dell'area?

boardgame.name: Monster Hunts Weekly: Issue 01
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Monster Hunts Weekly presents a collection of one-shot adventures, full color maps, new creatures, magical items, plot hooks and harvest tables to quickly inject into your Dungeons and Dragons games!

boardgame.name: Monster Hunts Weekly: Issue 02
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Monster Hunts Weekly presents a collection of one-shot adventures, full color maps, new creatures, magical items, plot hooks and harvest tables to quickly inject into your Dungeons and Dragons games!
